translated: Then the youth Candraprabha rose from his seat, removed his robe from one shoulder, and, kneeling on his right knee, with palms placed together he bowed toward the Bhagavān and made this request: “Bhagavān, I would ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha a certain point, if the Bhagavān would grant me the opportunity to say it.”

original: evamukte bhagavān candraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtamāmantrayate smapṛccha tvaṃ kumārabhūta tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ yad yadeva kāṅkṣasi
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān candraprabham kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma apṛccha tvam kumāra bhūta tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham yat yat eva kāṅkṣasi

original: nāsti kumāra tathāgatasya sarvadharmeṣvajñātaṃ vā adṛṣṭaṃ vā aśrutaṃ vā aviditaṃ vā asākṣātkṛtaṃ vā anabhisaṃbuddhaṃ vā anantāparyanteṣu lokadhātuṣu

translated: Prince, there is nothing unknown, unseen, unheard, uncognized, unperceived, and unactualized by the Tathagata in the infinite and boundless world systems.

original: nityakṛtaste kumāra avakāśo bhavatu tathāgataṃ praśnaparipṛcchanāya /

translated: Prince, you always have the opportunity to ask the Tathagata a question.

analyzed: aham te tasya tasya eva praśnasya pṛṣṭasya vyākaraṇena cittam ārādhayiṣyāmi
translated: I will satisfy your mind by answering each question you ask.

translated: Then the youth Candraprabha, being pleased, elated, delighted, joyful, and happy, at that time spoke these verses to the Blessed One:
How does one who practices, O Fully Enlightened One, Protector of the World, Illuminator,

Bull among men, to be worshipped by gods and men,
Having attained the incomparable excellent vehicle,
Please explain, O Lord, when asked, O Best of Speakers.

A bodhisattva who practices with one quality

Free from faults and resentment, having abandoned doubts,

Namely, bodily restraint.
Restraint of speech.
Restraint of mind.

translated: Surpassing the objective supports.🔽Complete knowledge of the aggregates.🔽Equality of the elements.

translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the youthful Chandra Prabha, Young man, 'samadhi' is said to be the concentration of the mind.

It is non-connection.
It is the knowledge of connection.
It is the removal of burdens.
It is the knowledge of the Tathagata.

analyzed: buddha vṛṣabhi tā  rāga cikitsā  doṣa vyupaśamaḥ
translated: It is the supremacy of the Buddha.🔽It is the cure for desire.🔽It is the pacification of hatred.
It is the abandonment of delusion.
It is the practice of the yoked.
It is the avoidance of the unyoked.
It is the desire for unwholesome dharmas.

analyzed: saṃsārāt mokṣa kāma tā  adhyāśaya pratipattiḥ
translated: It is the desire for liberation from samsara.🔽It is the practice of the highest intention.
It is the cultivation of vigilance.
It is the non-abandonment of abandonment.
It is the protection of wholesome dharmas.🔽It is the lack of confidence in rebirths.
It is the lack of fabrication.
It is the non-attention to the internal sense bases.
It is the non-practice of the external sense objects.
It is not praising oneself.
It is not disparaging others.
It is not being attached to the wholesome.🔽It is not trusting ordinary people.
It is the outflow of morality.
It is being difficult to approach.
It is having great splendor.
It is self-knowledge.
It is not being fickle.
It is maintaining the perfection of conduct.🔽It is non-ill will.
It is non-harming.
It is not oppressing others.🔽It is protecting friends.
It is guarding secret mantras.
It is non-violence.
It is not oppressing those with morality.
It is speaking gently.
It is not relying on any of the three realms.
It is the emptiness of all phenomena.
It is the favorable acceptance.

original: sarvajñajñāne tīvracchandatā samādhiḥ samādhiriti kumāra ucyate /
analyzed: sarvajña jñāne tīvra chanda tā samādhiḥ samādhiḥ iti kumāraḥ ucyate
translated: It is the intense aspiration for omniscient knowledge. This, young man, is called concentration.

analyzed: yā eva iṣu evaṃrūpeṣu dharmeṣu pratipattiḥ apratipattiḥ
translated: It is the practice and non-practice of these very kinds of phenomena.

analyzed: ayam sa kumāraḥ ucyate samādhiḥ iti
translated: This, young man, is called concentration.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata🔽apāvṛtaṃ me amṛtasya dvāram
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata 🔽apāvṛtam me amṛtasya dvāram
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:
The nature of phenomena is taught just as it is.
The kind of rebirth I have is shown,
And nirvana with its benefits is revealed.
Evil friends should always be avoided,
And virtuous friends should always be attended to.
One should dwell in the forest, abandoning crowds,
And always cultivate a mind of loving-kindness.
Pure morality should always be guarded,
And one should always find nourishment in gambling.
Generosity and wisdom should be practiced.
This samadhi will not be difficult to attain.
Then, having attained this peaceful ground,
Which is not the ground of the many shravakas,
The Sugata's Dharma will be directly perceived,
And you will attain the inconceivable qualities of a Buddha.
Seeing people who are wise in the Buddha's teachings,
You should inspire them to the mind of enlightenment.
Having established them in unsurpassed knowledge,
This king of samadhis will not be difficult to attain.

original: yasyārthi īrṣā puna saṃjaneyyā🔽āhāri niṣyandiha pratyavekṣataḥ /
analyzed: yasya arthi īrṣā puna saṃjaneyyā 🔽āhāri nisyandi iha pratyavekṣataḥ
translated: If, out of jealousy, one should generate it again,🔽Contemplating the consequences of food,
Through seeking and through enjoyment,
This samādhi will not be difficult to attain.
If this king of samādhis is empty,
It stands at the head of those with pure morality.
The nature of phenomena is always in samādhi,
But the untrained in yoga do not know this.
For those who desire this peaceful samādhi,

analyzed: na teṣa jātu bhaya buddhi tiṣṭhati
translated: The thought of fear never arises.
Always contemplating the supreme among men,
Having resorted to this ground of peace.
One who remembers the Tathāgatas according to their aspects,
Has peaceful faculties and a peaceful mind.
With a mind free from error, always in samādhi,
With learning and knowledge like the ocean.
Having been established in this samādhi,
The bodhisattva who walks on the walkway,
Sees many thousands of millions of buddhas,
More numerous than the sands of the Ganges.
The mind of a man would become deranged
If he were to grasp the measure of the Buddha's teachings.
The immeasurable has no measure,
The inconceivable guides are endowed with all good qualities.

analyzed: na saḥ usti sattvaḥ daśasu diśāsu
translated: There is no being in the ten directions
Who is equal to the Lord of the World, let alone superior.
For all are endowed with the qualities of omniscience.
Aspire, and you will attain the knowledge of the Buddhas.
With a body of golden color,
The Lord of the World is pleasing to behold from all sides.

analyzed: yasya atra ālambani cit tu vartate
translated: One whose mind is focused on that
Is said to be a concentrated bodhisattva.
The wise one, knowing the unconditioned and the conditioned,
Having eliminated the perception of signs,
Rests in the signless.
Understanding all phenomena to be empty,
One who is established in the dharmakāya
Knows all existents to be nonexistent.
Having eliminated the perception of nonexistence,
One does not see the Victorious One's body of form.

original: ārocayāmi prativedayāmi vo🔽yathā yathā bahu ca vitarkayennaraḥ /🔽tathā tathā bhavati tannimittacitta
analyzed: ārocayāmi prativedayāmi vaḥ  yathā yathā bahu ca vitarkayet naraḥ  tathā tathā bhavati tad nimitta citta
translated: I proclaim and make known to you🔽That as much as a person contemplates,🔽To that extent their mind becomes focused on that sign,
Dependent on those thoughts.
Thus, for a person who recollects the Lord of Sages
in terms of his form, immeasurable knowledge,
and always cultivates recollection,

analyzed: tat nimna cittam bhavatī tat proṇam
translated: his mind becomes inclined towards him, devoted to him.

analyzed: sa caṃkrama sthaḥ na niṣadyam āśrita
translated: While walking, not relying on sitting,
he aspires for the knowledge of the Supreme Man.
Aspiring, he makes a vow for enlightenment,
I will become a victorious one, unsurpassed in the world.
He knows the Buddha, sees the Buddha,
and observes the dharmatā of the Buddhas.
Having established himself in this samādhi,
he pays homage to the Buddhas with great power.
With body, speech, and a delighted mind,
he constantly praises the virtues of the Buddhas.

analyzed: tathā hi saḥ bhāvita citta saṃtatī
translated: Thus, he who has cultivated the continuum of mind
sees the Lords of the World day and night.
Even when he becomes sick and afflicted,
when feelings arise that end in death,
his recollection does not fail regarding the Buddha,
and he is not overwhelmed by feelings.
For thus it is known by him after investigation,
The emptiness of future and present phenomena.
He who is established in such a way of Dharma,
His mind does not tire while practicing the practice.
Therefore, having heard these benefits,
Generate enthusiasm for incomparable enlightenment.
Do not be remorseful in the future,
For seeing the excellent Sugatas is very difficult.
I will teach the excellent Dharma,
And you, having heard, should practice it.
A sick person who has taken medicine and clothes
Is not able to cure his own illness.
Therefore, by one who knows the method, who is wise,
Who always desires this samādhi,
Morality, learning, and generosity should be practiced,
For this samādhi will not be difficult to obtain.

analyzed: iti śrī samādhirāje buddhānusmṛtiparivartaḥ nāma caturthaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the fourth chapter in the Samādhi of the Great Sage, called the Chapter on the Recollection of the Buddha.

translated: Thus, young man, the Blessed One Ghoṣadatta thought, ‘Alas, these beings are declining in their commitment to moral discipline and the observance of the fast, in their approach to the Tathāgata, in their service to the Tathāgata, in their practice of celibacy, in their going forth and ordination as monks, and in their state as fully ordained monks.

analyzed: atha khalu kumāra ghoṣadattaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tasyām velāyām rājñaḥ mahābalasya teṣām ca brāhmaṇa gṛhapatīnām saṃvejana abhiprāye imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then, young man, at that time, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Ghoṣadatta, with the intention of inspiring King Mahābala and those brahmins and householders, spoke these verses:

translated: There, beginning with the earthly gods up to the world of Brahmā, they proclaimed the sound by word of mouth, they made the sound heard: Surely this Tathāgata will be one who has arisen from non-existence.

original: yo jātamātra evoparyantarīkṣe saptatālamātramabhyudgamya sapta padāni prakramitvā abhāvaśabdamudīrayati /
analyzed: yaḥ jāta mātraḥ eva upari antarīkṣe sapta tāla mātram abhyudgamya sapta padāni prakramitvā abhāva śabdam udīrayati
translated: For as soon as he was born, he rose up in the air to the height of seven tālas, took seven steps, and proclaimed the sound of non-existence.

original: iti hyabhāvasamudgato'bhāvasamudgata iti tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyamudapādi /
analyzed: iti hi abhāva samudgataḥ abhāva samudgataḥ iti tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam udapādi
translated: Thus, he became known as the Tathāgata Abhāva-saṃgīti, One who has arisen from non-existence.

original: tasya ca bhagavato bodhiprāptasya sarvavṛkṣapatrebhyaḥ sarvatṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatibhyaḥ sarvaśailaśikharebhyaścābhāvasamudgataśabdo niścarati
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavataḥ bodhi prāptasya sarva vṛkṣa patrebhyaḥ sarva tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatibhyaḥ sarva śaila śikharebhyaḥ ca abhāva samudgata śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: And when that Blessed One attained enlightenment, the sound of non-existence issued forth from all the tree leaves, from all the grass, bushes, herbs, and forests, and from all the mountain peaks.

original: yāvati ca tatra lokadhātau śabdaprajñaptiḥ sarvato'bhāvasamudgatavijñaptiśabdo niścarati /
analyzed: yāvati ca tatra lokadhātau śabda prajñaptiḥ sarvatobhāva samudgata vijñapti śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: And as far as the designation of sound extends in that world system, from everywhere there issued forth the sound of the proclamation of non-existence.

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tasya bhagavato'bhāvasamudgatasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane mahākaruṇācintī nāma rājakumāro'bhūdabhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ paramaśubhavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tasya bhagavatobhāvasamudgatasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane mahākaruṇācintī nāma rāja kumāraḥ bhūt abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ parama śubha varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgataḥ
translated: “Young man, at that time, during the teaching of the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Abhāva­samudgata, there was a young man named Mahā­karuṇā­cintin, who was handsome, good-looking, and attractive, and who possessed supreme, excellent, and complete beauty.

original: atha khalu kumāra sa mahākaruṇācintī nāma rājakumāro yena bhagavān abhāvasamudgatastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastenosaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu kumāra sa mahākaruṇācintī nāma rāja kumāraḥ yena bhagavān abhāvasamudgataḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena usaṃkrāmat
translated: “Then, young man, the young man Mahā­karuṇā­cintin went to the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Abhāva­samudgata.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte'sthāt //
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte sthāt
translated: He bowed his head down to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavān three times, and sat to one side.

original: atha khalu kumāra sa bhagavān abhāvasamudgatastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho mahākaruṇācintino rājakumārasyādhyāśayaṃ viditvā imaṃ samādhiṃ deśayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kumāra sa bhagavān abhāvasamudgataḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ mahā karuṇā cintinaḥ rāja kumārasya adhyāśayam viditvā imam samādhim deśayāmāsa
translated: “Then, young man, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Abhāva­samudgata, knowing the higher motivation of the young man Mahā­karuṇā­cintin, taught him this samādhi.

original: atha khalu kumāra sa mahākaruṇācintī rājakumāraḥ imaṃ samādhiṃ śrutvā tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ prasīdati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu kumāra sa mahā karuṇā cintī rāja kumāraḥ imam samādhim śrutvā tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ prasīdati sma
translated: Then, young man, the prince Mahākaruṇācintin, having heard this samādhi, was pleased, delighted, joyful, and experienced satisfaction and happiness. He became serene.

original: prasannacittaśca keśaśmaśrūṇyavatārya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi paridhāya samyageva śraddhayā agārādanagārikāṃ pravrajito'bhūt /
analyzed: prasanna cittaḥ ca keśa śmaśrūṇi avatārya kāṣāyāṇi vastrāṇi paridhāya samyak eva śraddhayā agārāt anagārikām pravrajitaḥ bhūt
translated: With a serene mind, he shaved off his hair and beard, put on the orange robes, and with right faith went forth from the household life into the homeless state.

analyzed: sa pravrajitaḥ san imam samādhim udgṛhītavān
translated: Having gone forth, he took up this samādhi.

original: udgṛhya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā bhāvanāyogamanuyukto vyahārṣīt /
analyzed: udgṛhya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ vyahārṣīt
translated: Having taken it up, memorized it, kept it, read it, and contemplated it in meditation, he applied himself to yoga.

original: sa tainaiva kuśalamūlena viṃśatikalpakoṭyo na jātu durgativinipātamagamat /
analyzed: sa tainā eva kuśala mūlena viṃśati kalpa koṭyaḥ na jātu durgati vinipātam agamat
translated: By that very root of merit, for twenty koṭīs of eons he never went to the lower realms.

analyzed: viṃśatīnām kalpānām atyayena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhūt
translated: After twenty koṭīs of eons had passed, he attained supreme and perfect awakening.

original: suvicintitārtho nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi /
analyzed: suvicintitārthaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: He became the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly and Fully Enlightened One named Suvicintita-artha.

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu kalpeṣu viśatiṃ ca buddhakoṭīrārāgayāmāsa /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu kalpeṣu viśatim ca buddha koṭīḥ ārāgayāmāsa
translated: And in all those eons, he pleased twenty koṭīs of Buddhas.

original: paśya kumāra yathāyaṃ samādhirbahukaro bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmanuttarasya buddhajñānasya paripūraṇāya saṃvartate //
analyzed: paśya kumāra yathā ayam samādhiḥ bahu karaḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām anuttarasya buddha jñānasya paripūraṇāya saṃvartate
translated: Look, young man, how this samādhi is very beneficial for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, leading to the fulfillment of the unsurpassed wisdom of the buddhas.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:
I remember in the past, in a time gone by,
An inconceivable eon ago, there was a supreme human,
An exalted sage who appeared for the sake of the world,
His name was Abhāva-samudgata (Arisen from Non-existence).
As soon as he was born, he stood in the sky
And taught the non-existence of all phenomena.
Then a fitting name was given to him,
And by that name, he made the whole trichiliocosm known.
All the gods also let out a cry,
The Victor will be called Abhāvu (Non-existent),

analyzed: yaḥ jāta mātraḥ pada sapta prakrama
translated: Who, as soon as he is born, takes seven steps
And the guide proclaims the non-existence of phenomena.
When he becomes a buddha, a Dharma king,
A sage who illuminates all phenomena,

analyzed: tṛṇa vṛkṣa gulma oṣadhi śaila parvate
translated: In the grass, trees, shrubs, herbs, rocks, and mountains,
The sound of the non-existence of phenomena will be heard.
As many sounds as there are in that world system,

original: sarve hyabhāvā na hi kaści bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sarve hi abhāvāḥ na hi kaści bhāvaḥ
translated: All are non-existent, there is no existence at all.
To that extent, of that Tathagata,
The sound of the world's guide emerges.

analyzed: tasmin ca kāle abhu rāja putraḥ
translated: And at that time there was a prince,
Always named Karunavicinti.
Handsome, graceful, and beautiful,

original: upāgamī tasya jinasya antikam // //🔽vanditva pādau munipuṃgavasya
analyzed: upāgamī tasya jinasya antikam  vanditva pādau muni puṃgavasya
translated: He approached the presence of that Victor.🔽Having bowed at the feet of the Sage, the bull among sages,
And circumambulated him with reverence,
With a joyful mind he sat there
To listen to the stainless, unsurpassed Dharma.

original: sa co jino āśayu jñātva dhīraḥ
translated: And that Victor, knowing the resolute one's intention,
Proclaimed this very concentration.

original: śrutvā ca so imu virajaṃ samādhiṃ
analyzed: śrutvā ca saḥ imu virajam samādhim
translated: Having heard this stainless concentration,
He quickly went forth in this teaching of the Victor.
Having gone forth and upheld this concentration,
Recited it, and mastered it,
For twenty full koṭis of kalpas
He never went to the realm of downfall.

analyzed: sa tena ca evam kuśalena karmaṇā
translated: Through that wholesome action,
he pleased twenty million buddhas.
In the presence of all those Jinas,
he cultivated this excellent peaceful samādhi.
In a later time, he became a Buddha in the world,
with the name Sucinta-nārtha.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca artham bahu prāṇa koṭinām
translated: Having benefited many millions of beings,
he passed into Nirvāṇa like a flame.

analyzed: tasmāt hi yaḥ icchati bodhi buddhitum
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to attain enlightenment
and liberate beings from the ocean of existence,
should uphold this sūtra praised by the Buddha.
The supreme enlightenment will not be difficult to attain.

analyzed: iti śrī samādhirāje abhāvasamudgataparivartaḥ nāma aṣṭamaḥ  /
translated: Thus concludes Chapter Eight, named The Chapter on the Arising of Non-existence in the Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra The King of Samādhis, the Revealed Equality of the Nature of All Phenomena.
The Chapter on the Patience of the Profound Dharma.

original: tatra bhagavān punarapi candraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtamāmantrayate smatasmāttarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvenemaṃ samādhimākāṅkṣatā kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena gambhīradharmakṣāntikuśalena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān punar api candraprabham kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma tasmāt tarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imam samādhim ākāṅkṣatā kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena gambhīra dharma kṣānti kuśalena bhavitavyam
translated: There the Blessed One said to the youth Candraprabha, “Therefore, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who desires this samādhi, who desires to quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, should be skilled in the acceptance of the profound Dharma.

original: kathaṃ ca kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo gambhīradharmakṣāntikuśalo bhavati /
analyzed: katham ca kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ gambhīra dharma kṣānti kuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: And how, young man, is a bodhisattva mahāsattva skilled in the acceptance of the profound Dharma?

original: iha kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena māyopamāḥ sarvadharmā yathābhūtataḥ prajñātavyāḥ /
analyzed: iha kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena māyā upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ yathā bhūtataḥ prajñātavyāḥ
translated: Here, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should know all dharmas as they really are, as being like an illusion.

original: svapnopamā marīcyupamāḥ pratiśrutkopamāḥ pratibhāsopamā udakacandropamā nirmitopamāḥ pratibimbopamā ākāśopamāḥ sarvadharmāḥ prajñātavyāḥ /
analyzed: svapna upamāḥ marīci upamāḥ pratiśrutkā upamāḥ pratibhāsa upamāḥ udaka candra upamāḥ nirmita upamāḥ pratibimba upamāḥ ākāśa upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ prajñātavyāḥ
translated: All dharmas should be known as being like a dream, like a mirage, like an echo, like an apparition, like the moon in water, like a magical creation, like a reflection, and like space.

original: yadā ca kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena māyopamāḥ sarvadharmāḥ parijñātā bhavanti /
analyzed: yadā ca kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena māyā upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ parijñātāḥ bhavanti
translated: And when, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva has fully known all dharmas as being like an illusion,

original: svapnopamā marīcyupamāḥ pratiśrutkopamāḥ pratibhāsopamā udakacandropamā nirmitopamāḥ pratibimbopamā ākāśopamāḥ sarvadharmāḥ parijñātā bhavanti yathābhūtataḥ tadāyaṃ kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo gambhīradharmakṣāntikuśala ityucyate /
analyzed: svapna upamāḥ marīci upamāḥ pratiśrutkā upamāḥ pratibhāsa upamāḥ udaka candra upamāḥ nirmita upamāḥ pratibimba upamāḥ ākāśa upamāḥ sarva dharmāḥ parijñātāḥ bhavanti yathā bhūtataḥ tadā ayam kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ gambhīra dharma kṣānti kuśalaḥ iti ucyate
translated: The young man, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has that kind of profound acceptance of the Dharma is called one who is skilled in the profound acceptance of the Dharma.

original: sa gambhīrayā dharmakṣāntyā samanvāgato rañjanīyeṣu dharmeṣu na rajyate /🔽doṣaṇīyeṣu dharmeṣu na duṣyate /
analyzed: sa gambhīrayā dharma kṣāntyā samanvāgataḥ rañjanīyeṣu dharmeṣu na rajyate  doṣaṇīyeṣu dharmeṣu na duṣyate
translated: Endowed with that profound acceptance of the Dharma, he is not attached to delightful dharmas.🔽He is not averse to hateful dharmas.
He is not deluded about delusory dharmas.
Why is that?

original: tathā hisa taṃ dharmaṃ na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: tathā hi sa tam dharmam na samanupaśyati
translated: Because he does not see that dharma.
He does not apprehend that dharma.
That by which one would be attached, or to which one would be attached,
or by which one would be attached.
That by which one would be averse, or to which one would be averse,
or by which one would be averse.
That by which one would be deluded, or to which one would be deluded,

original: yena vā muhyeta /🔽sa taṃ dharmaṃ na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: yena vā muhyeta  sa tam dharmam na samanupaśyati
translated: or by which one would be deluded.🔽He does not see that dharma.
He does not apprehend that dharma.

analyzed: tam dharmam a samanupaśyan an upalabhamānaḥ raktaḥ duṣṭaḥ mūḍhaḥ viparyasta cittaḥ samāhitaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Not seeing or perceiving that dharma, he is said to be not attached, not averse, not deluded, not confused in mind, and concentrated.
He is free from conceptual proliferation.🔽He has crossed over and reached the other shore.
He has reached dry land.
He has attained security.
He has attained the formless.
He has good conduct.🔽He has knowledge.
He has wisdom.
He has merit.🔽He has spiritual power.🔽He has mindfulness.
He has intelligence.
He has understanding.🔽He has a sense of shame.
He has fortitude.🔽He has good character.
He has the virtues of austerity and simplicity.🔽He is free from defilements.
He has nothing.
He is an arhat.
He has exhausted the defilements.

original: niṣkleśo vaśībhūtaḥ suvimuktacittaḥ suvimuktaprajñaḥ ājāneyo mahānāgaḥ kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛtakaraṇīyo'pahṛtabhāro'nuprāptasvakārthaḥ parikṣīṇabhavasaṃyojanaḥ samyagājñāsuvimuktacittaḥ sarvacetovaśiparamapāramitāprāptaḥ śramaṇaḥ /
analyzed: niṣkleśaḥ vaśībhūtaḥ su vimukta cittaḥ su vimukta prajñaḥ ājāneyaḥ mahā nāgaḥ kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛta karaṇīya upahṛta bhāraḥ anuprāpta svaka arthaḥ parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanaḥ samyagājñā su vimukta cittaḥ sarva cetaḥ vaśi parama pāramitā prāptaḥ śramaṇaḥ
translated: He is free from afflictions, has attained mastery, has a well-liberated mind, has well-liberated wisdom, is a great elephant, has done what had to be done, has done what had to be accomplished, has cast off the burden, has attained his own goal, has exhausted the fetters of existence, has a mind well-liberated by right knowledge, has attained the highest perfection of mental control, is an ascetic,
a brahmin, a graduate,
a master, a listener, a scholar,
a son of the Buddha,
a son of the Śākyas, one who has crushed the thorns,

analyzed: utkṣipta parikhaḥ  udīrṇa parikhaḥ  ākṣipta śalyaḥ
translated: One who has thrown out the moat.🔽One who has filled up the moat.🔽One who has extracted the dart.
One who is free from disease.
A monk.
One who is not wrapped up.🔽A man.
A good man.🔽A supreme man.
A great man.🔽A lion among men.

analyzed: puruṣa nāgaḥ  puruṣājāneyaḥ  puruṣa dhaureyaḥ puruṣa śūraḥ
translated: An elephant among men.🔽A thoroughbred among men.🔽A bull among men, a hero among men.
A hero among men.🔽A flower among men.🔽A lotus among men.
A white lotus among men.🔽A tamer of men.
The moon among men.
A man who is not defiled.
He is called a man who is not smeared by men.

original: atha khalu bhagavāstasyāṃ velāyamimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyam imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:
When the world-system is not formed,
this entire world becomes space,

analyzed: yathā eva tam pūrvu tathā eva paścāt
translated: just as it was before, so it is afterwards;
know all phenomena to be like this.

original: idaṃ jagad yāva ca kiṃci vartate
analyzed: idam jagat yāva ca kiṃci vartate
translated: Whatever exists in this world
below goes into the water element,

analyzed: yathā eva tam heṣṭhe tathā eva ūrdhvam
translated: just as it was below, so it is above;
know all phenomena to be like this.
Just as in the sky there is no cloud,

analyzed: kṣaṇena ca u dṛśyati abhra maṇḍalam
translated: And in an instant, a circle of clouds appears.
Know from where it arose in the past,
And know all phenomena in the same way.
Just as the reflection of the Thus-Gone One,
Who has passed into nirvāṇa, is seen when one brings it to mind,

analyzed: yathā eva tam pūrvu tathā eva paścāt
translated: Just as it was before, so it is afterwards,
Know all phenomena in the same way.
Just as a person sees a large lump of foam
Uprooted by the wind,

analyzed: nirīkṣya saḥ tatra na sāra saṃdarśī
translated: And upon examining it, does not see any essence there,
Know all phenomena in the same way.

original: deve yathā varṣati sthūlabinduke🔽pṛthak pṛthag budbuda saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: deve yathā varṣati sthūlabinduke  pṛthak pṛthak budbuda saṃbhavanti
translated: Just as when the gods rain down in large drops,🔽Blisters form separately,

analyzed: utpanna bhagnāḥ na hi santi budbudāḥ
translated: And once arisen and broken, the blisters do not exist,
Know all phenomena in the same way.

analyzed: yathā eva grāma antari lekha darśanāt
translated: Just as from seeing a letter from another village,
Actions are set in motion, good and bad, separately,
But the letter does not pass to the voice,
Know all phenomena in the same way.
Just as a person deluded by pride and arrogance,
Wandering, they perceive the earth.

original: na co mahīyā calitaṃ na kampitaṃ
analyzed: na ca u calitam na kampitam
translated: But the great earth is neither moved nor shaken.

original: tathopamān jānatha sarvadharmān // //🔽ādarśapṛṣṭhe tatha tailapātre🔽nirīkṣate nāri mukhaṃ svalaṃkṛtam /
analyzed: tathā upamān jānatha sarva dharmān  ādarśa pṛṣṭhe taila pātre  nirīkṣate nāri mukham su alaṃkṛtam
translated: Know all phenomena to be like this.🔽Just as a woman adorns her face in a mirror or oil vessel,🔽And looks at it, the foolish girl
Generates passion there,
And runs away, seeking pleasure.
When there is no transference of the face,

analyzed: bimbe mukham nā eva kadācid labhyate
translated: The face is never found in the reflection.
As that fool generates passion,
Know all phenomena to be like this.
Just as a gandharva city, a mirage,

analyzed: yathā eva māyā supinam yathā eva
translated: Just as an illusion, a dream,
The cultivation of signs is empty of inherent nature.

original: tathopamān jānatha sarvadharmān // //🔽yathaiva candrasya nabhe viśuddhe
analyzed: tathā upamān jānatha sarva dharmān  yathā eva candrasya nabhe viśuddhe
translated: Know all phenomena to be like this.🔽Just as the reflection of the moon is seen
In a clear sky and a clear pond,
The moon does not transfer to the water.
Know all phenomena to have that characteristic.
Just as a man standing in a mountain forest,
One might speak, sing, laugh, or cry,

analyzed: pratiśrutkā śrūyati na u ca dṛśyate
translated: An echo is heard but not seen.
Know all phenomena to be like this.

original: gīte ca vādye ca tathaiva rodite
analyzed: gīte ca vādye ca tathā eva rodite
translated: In singing, music, and likewise in crying,
An echo arises in dependence on that.
The sound of speech is never found.
Know all phenomena to be like this.
Just as one enjoys desires in a dream,
When a person awakens, he does not see them.

translated: The Tathāgatas have the same nature as the qualities of the Buddha.
All phenomena have that same nature.

original: yaḥ kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ sarvaguṇasvabhāvanirdeśaṃ yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: yaḥ kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam sarva guṇa svabhāva nirdeśam yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Young man, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who thus knows, as they are, the teaching of the nature of all qualities,

original: ayaṃ kumāra ucyate bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nidhyāptimānasaḥ /
analyzed: ayam kumāraḥ ucyate bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nidhi āpti mānasaḥ
translated: is said, young man, to be a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has a mind that penetrates deeply,
who is skilled in liberation,
who knows, as they are, the liberation from the three realms,
who sees things as they are, who speaks the truth and not otherwise, who does not speak falsely,
who does as he speaks,
who is not attached to the three realms, who has transcended the three realms,

original: samatikrāntaḥ kāmabhūmiṃ rūpabhūmiṃ ārūpyabhūmiṃ kleśabhūmiṃ nāmabhūmiṃ ghoṣabhūmim /
analyzed: samatikrāntaḥ kāma bhūmim rūpa bhūmim ārūpya bhūmim kleśa bhūmim nāma bhūmim ghoṣa bhūmim
translated: He has transcended the realm of desire, the realm of form, the formless realm, the realm of afflictions, the realm of names, and the realm of sounds.
He is skilled in the path of syllables and words.
He has the knowledge that illuminates syllables.
He is skilled in the inexpressible Dharma.
He knows the syllables.

analyzed: akṣara kuśalaḥ  akṣara pada prabheda jñāna kuśalaḥ
translated: He is skilled in the syllables.🔽He is skilled in the knowledge of the distinctions of syllables and words.

analyzed: akṣara pada prabheda vistāra jñāna kuśalaḥ  sarva dharma pada prabheda kuśalaḥ
translated: He is skilled in the knowledge of the details of the distinctions of syllables and words.🔽He is skilled in the distinctions of all Dharma words.

analyzed: sarva dharma pada prabheda vistāra kuśalaḥ
translated: He is skilled in the details of the distinctions of all Dharma words.
He is skilled in the knowledge of the arrangement of all dharmas.

original: niścitayā buddhyā samanvāgato'nabhibhūtaḥ sarvamāraiḥ pāpīyobhirmārakāyikābhiśca devatābhiḥ //
analyzed: niścitayā buddhyā samanvāgataḥ na abhibhūtaḥ sarva māraiḥ pāpīyobhiḥ māra kāyikābhiḥ ca devatābhiḥ
translated: He is endowed with certain wisdom and is invincible to all evil Maras and the deities of Mara's retinue.

original: asmin khalu punardharmaparyāye bhāṣyamāṇe aṣṭānavaterniyutānāṃ devamānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ pūrvaparikarmakṛtāyāḥ koṭīśatasahasrāvartāyā dhāraṇyā anāvaraṇāyāśca dharmavipaśyanāyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilambho'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar dharmaparyāye bhāṣyamāṇe aṣṭānavateḥ niyutānām deva mānuṣikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ pūrva parikarma kṛtāyāḥ koṭī śata sahasra āvartāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ anāvaraṇāyāḥ ca dharma vipaśyanāyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: Moreover, when this Dharma teaching was being spoken, 8,900,000,000 beings of the divine and human realms who had previously undergone spiritual training attained the dhāraṇī that turns back the great hordes, the unobstructed dhāraṇī, and the acceptance of the insight into phenomena.

original: te ca sarve bhagavatā vyākṛutā aṣṭācatvāriṃśatā kalpairasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrairanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: te ca sarve bhagavatā aṣṭācatvāriṃśatā kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeya śata sahasraiḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: And they were all predicted by the Blessed One to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in thirty-four incalculably long eons.

original: sarve ca anyānyanāmāna ekāyuṣpramāṇā anyānyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: sarve ca anya anya nāmānaḥ eka āyuṣpramāṇāḥ anya anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: And all of them, with different names and the same lifespan, will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in other buddha-fields.
Regarding this, it is said:

original: yo bodhisattva matimān prāpnoti anuttarāṃ varāṃ bodhim /
analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattva matimān prāpnoti anuttarām varām bodhim
translated: The wise bodhisattva who attains the unsurpassed, supreme enlightenment,

original: arthe ca dharmi kuśalo carati sa dharmasvabhāvasmi // //
translated: Skilful in the meaning and the Dharma, practices in the nature of phenomena.

original: nābhūt bhaṇati vācaṃ buddhānāṃ yādṛśā guṇaviśeṣāḥ /
analyzed: bhaṇati vācam buddhānām yādṛśāḥ guṇa viśeṣāḥ
translated: He does not speak words that are not true about the qualities of the buddhas,

original: sa hi dharmu taṃ jinānāṃ jānati śūro vigatakaṅkṣāḥ // //
analyzed: sa hi tam jinānām jānati śūraḥ vigata kaṅkṣāḥ
translated: The hero who knows the Dharma of the victorious ones, free from doubt.

original: ekārtha sarvadharmān prajānati ca śūnyatāṃ sa ekāṃśam /
analyzed: eka artha sarva dharmān prajānati ca śūnyatām saḥ eka aṃśam
translated: He understands all phenomena to have one meaning, and emptiness as the single factor.

original: nānārthu nāsti teṣāṃ ekārthe śikṣito bhavati // //🔽niṣkalpānavikalpān anopalambhāṃśca jānāti matimān /
analyzed: nānārthu na asti teṣām ekārthe śikṣitaḥ bhavati  niṣkalpān avikalpān anopalambhān ca jānāti matimān
translated: They do not have multiple meanings, he trains in the single meaning.🔽The wise one knows them to be free from conceptualization, free from discrimination, and free from apprehension.

original: kṣati akṣaye'sya saṃjñā prahīṇa sarvā niravaśeṣā // //
translated: His perception of destruction and non-destruction is abandoned without remainder.

original: na hi rūpato daśabalān paśyati so dharmakāya narasiṃhān /
analyzed: na hi rūpataḥ daśa balān paśyati saḥ dharmakāya nara siṃhān
translated: For one does not see the Buddhas, the Lions among men, the Ten-Powered Ones, in terms of form, but in the Dharma-body.

original: nāpi lakṣaṇehi tasya prahīṇa sarve viparyāsāḥ // //
translated: And one does not see them in terms of characteristics, for all misconceptions have been eliminated.

original: dharmā acintya ete cintāpagatā svabhāva upaśāntāḥ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ a cintyaḥ ete cintā apagatā svabhāvaḥ upaśāntāḥ
translated: These dharmas are inconceivable, beyond thought, by nature peaceful.

analyzed: evam prajānamānaḥ paśyati buddhān dvipada śreṣṭhān
translated: One who understands this sees the Buddhas, the best of two-legged beings.

analyzed: jñātvā ātma saṃjñāḥ tathā eva sarvatra preṣitā buddhiḥ
translated: Just as one's own perception is known, so too is the mind sent everywhere.

original: sarve ca tatsvabhāvā dharma viśuddhā gaganakalpāḥ // //
analyzed: sarve ca tad svabhāvāḥ dharma viśuddhāḥ gagana kalpāḥ
translated: And all dharmas are of that nature, pure like the sky.

original: na hi jāta mānase'sya niḥsaraṇaṃ jñātva sarvadharmāṇām /
analyzed: na hi jāta mānasesya niḥsaraṇam sarva dharmāṇām
translated: For one whose mind is born thus knows the deliverance of all dharmas.
There is no aspiration for liberation in the three realms for one who is thus.
One becomes a true seer, one whose words are not false, one who speaks without contradiction.

original: sarvaṃ ca tasya vacanaṃ niścarati jinānubhāvena // //
analyzed: sarvam ca tasya vacanam niścarati jina anubhāvena
translated: And all one's words issue forth through the power of the Victorious Ones.

original: atikrāntu kāmabhūmiṃ kileśabhūmiṃ ca rūpa ārūpyān /
analyzed: atikrāntu kāma bhūmim kileśa bhūmim ca rūpe ārūpyān
translated: One transcends the realm of desire, the realm of defilements, and the form and formless realms.

analyzed: dharmeṣu asakta manasaḥ pramudita carate jaga hitāya  /
translated: With a mind unattached to dharmas, one delights in conduct for the benefit of the world.

original: atikrāntu nāmabhūmiṃ ghoṣo jñāna svabhāvena cayikaḥ /
translated: One transcends the realm of names, and sound is known to be merely conceptual.

original: yāvacciraṃ pi bhaṇato na vidyate niśrayastasya // //
analyzed: yāvat ciram bhaṇataḥ na vidyate niśrayaḥ tasya
translated: Even if one speaks for a long time, there is no basis for that.

analyzed: saṃjñā pracāru na asti dṛṣṭi viparyāsu sarvaśas kṣīṇaḥ
translated: There is no occurrence of conceptualization, all mistaken views are completely exhausted.

analyzed: su niścitā buddhiḥ ca te gagana upama dhīrāḥ
translated: And your mind is well-determined, steadfast like space.

analyzed: vihāra koṭī niyutāḥ bhaveyu vikṣepaṇa artha cittasya
translated: There may be many quintillions of abodes for the sake of distracting the mind.

original: abhibhavati sarvamārān na cāpi teṣāṃ vaśamupaiti // //
analyzed: abhibhavati sarva mārān na ca api teṣām vaśam upaiti  /
translated: One overcomes all māras and does not fall under their power.
One abandons all the nets of Māra, being pure, virtuous, and without burning.

original: dhyānasukhasmi nirataḥ prajānati ca śūnyakaṃ lokam // //
translated: Delighting in the bliss of meditation, one understands the world to be empty.

original: lokāśca skandha uktāstāṃścāpi sa śūnyakān prajānati /
analyzed: lokāḥ ca skandhaḥ uktāḥ tān ca api sa śūnyakān prajānati
translated: And the aggregates are said to be the world, and one also understands them to be empty.

analyzed: anutpāda ananirodhān sarvān gagana upamān dharmān
translated: All phenomena are like space, unborn and unceasing.

original: ātmānaṃ sa tyajate na caiva śikṣāṃ śrutāṃ daśabalasya /
analyzed: ātmānam sa tyajate na ca eva śikṣām śrutām daśabalasya
translated: One abandons oneself but not the training and learning of the one with the ten powers.

original: so śīlapāramiṃ gata upapadyati yatra praṇidheti // //
analyzed: saḥ śīla pāramim gataḥ upapadyati yatra praṇidhā iti
translated: Having gone to the perfection of morality, one is reborn wherever one vows.

analyzed: vicarantu buddhakṣetrān paśyati buddha koṭī niyutāni
translated: Wandering through the buddha-fields, one sees many quintillions of buddhas.

original: na svargaṃ prārthayate na cāpi praṇidhānato muktaḥ // //
analyzed: na svargam prārthayate na ca api praṇidhānataḥ muktaḥ  /
translated: One does not seek heaven, and is also not liberated through vows.

original: na bhraṃśayati sa vīryaṃ muhūrtamātramapi dharma caramāṇaḥ /
analyzed: na bhraṃśayati sa vīryam muhūrta mātram api dharma caramāṇaḥ
translated: He does not abandon his diligence even for a moment while practicing the Dharma.

analyzed: praśaṃsitaḥ ca bhoti buddhabhiḥ daśa diśe loke  /
translated: And he is praised by the Buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kumāra śrutvā dharmān imān
translated: Therefore, young man, having heard this Dharma in this samādhi,

analyzed: jahiyāna jñātra lābham prakāśaya mahājane dharmam
translated: Abandoning the gain of fame, teach the Dharma to the great assembly.

analyzed: yaḥ icchati svayaṃbhūḥ bhaveya buddhaḥ mahā guṇa samaṅgī
translated: He who wishes to become a self-existent one, a Buddha endowed with great qualities,

original: iha śikṣitvā kuśalo daśabaladhārī bhavati buddhaḥ // //
analyzed: iha śikṣitvā kuśalaḥ daśa bala dhārī bhavati buddhaḥ  /
translated: Having trained in this, he becomes a skilled one, a holder of the ten powers, a Buddha.

analyzed: iti śrī samādhirāje samādhyanuśikṣaṇāparivartaḥ nāma dvādaśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the Samādhi-Rāja Sūtra called The Chapter on the Training in the Samādhi.
The Chapter on the Teaching of the Samādhi

original: tatra khalu bhagavān punareva candraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtamāmantrayate smatasmāttarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena samādhinirdeśakuśalena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān punar eva candraprabham kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma tasmāt tarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena samādhi nirdeśa kuśalena bhavitavyam
translated: There the Blessed One again addressed the youth Candraprabha, saying, Therefore, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should be skilled in teaching the samādhi.
There, young man, what is the teaching of the samādhi?

analyzed: yā yathāvattata tā sarva dharmāṇām sama tā a viṣama tā
translated: It is the suchness, equality, and non-differentiation of all phenomena.

analyzed: akalpanā avikalpanā  a viṭhapanā a samutthāpanā
translated: Non-imagination and non-discrimination.🔽Non-display and non-arising.
Non-production and non-cessation.
Cutting off imagination, discrimination, and conceptualization.
The mind having no support.
Non-attention.🔽Cutting off designations.
Cutting off discursive thoughts and discrimination.
Cutting off desire, anger, and ignorance.
Infinite attention to the endless.
Cutting off attention.
Knowledge of the nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

analyzed: smṛti mati gati hrī dhṛti cāritra ācāra gocara pratipatti sthānam  araṇā bhūmiḥ
translated: The basis for mindfulness, intellect, understanding, shame, conscience, conduct, practice, and realization.🔽The stage of non-conflict.
The stage of peace.
Cutting off all conceptual proliferation.
The training of all bodhisattvas.
The domain of all tathagatas.
The perfection of all qualities.
This, young man, is called the instruction on samadhi.

original: yatra samādhinirdeśe pratiṣṭhito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'virahito bhavati samādhinā /
analyzed: yatra samādhi nirdeśe pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ virahitaḥ bhavati samādhinā
translated: In this instruction on samadhi, the bodhisattva mahasattva who is established becomes inseparable from samadhi.
And he becomes one whose mind is free from error.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā samanvāgata uprameyāṇām ca sattvānam artham karoti
translated: Endowed with great compassion, he accomplishes the welfare of immeasurable beings.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

analyzed: samādhi aviṣamā bhūmiḥ śāntā sūkṣmā su durdṛśā
translated: The uneven ground of concentration is peaceful, subtle, and difficult to see.

analyzed: sarva saṃjñā samuddhātaḥ samādhiḥ tena ca ucyate
translated: The complete elimination of all concepts is concentration, and that is why it is called so.

analyzed: a kalpaḥ ca a vikalpaḥ ca a grāhya tvam a nidarśanam
translated: It is non-conceptual, ungraspable, and invisible.

analyzed: anupalabdhiḥ cittasya samādhiḥ tena ca ucyate
translated: The non-apprehension of the mind is concentration, and that is why it is called so.

original: samāhito yadā bhoti sarvadharmā na manyate /
analyzed: samāhitaḥ yadā sarva dharmāḥ na manyate
translated: When one is concentrated, one does not think of any dharma.
The non-thinking of what is as it is is called concentration.

original: na dharme'sti rajomātra rajaścāpi na vidyate /
analyzed: na rajaḥ mātra rajaḥ ca api na vidyate
translated: There is no dust in the dharma, and dust is also not found.

analyzed: anupalabdhiḥ dharmāṇām samādhiḥ tena ca ucyate
translated: The non-apprehension of dharmas is concentration, and that is why it is called so.

analyzed: cittasya anupalabdhiḥ ca vikalpaḥ hi eṣa ca ucyate
translated: The non-apprehension of the mind is also called conceptualization.

analyzed: a vikalpitāḥ ca te dharmāḥ samādhiḥ eṣa jānathaḥ
translated: Those dharmas are non-conceptualized, and you should know this to be concentration.

original: śabdena sūcito hyarthaḥ sa ca śabdo avastukaḥ /
analyzed: śabdena sūcitaḥ hi arthaḥ sa ca śabdaḥ avastukaḥ
translated: The meaning is indicated by sound, and that sound is also baseless.

analyzed: pratiśrutkā upamaḥ śabdaḥ antarīkṣam yathā nabhaḥ
translated: Sound is like an echo, like the sky in the intermediate space.

original: asthitā hi ime dharmāḥ sthitireṣāṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: asthitāḥ hi ime dharmāḥ sthitiḥ eṣām na vidyate
translated: These dharmas are not established, they have no stability.

analyzed: asthitiḥ sthiti śabdena svabhāvena na labhyate
translated: Impermanence is not attained by nature with the word permanence.

original: cyavate agatītyevaṃ gatiścāsau na vidyate /🔽agatirgatiśabdena samādhirnaditastathā // //
analyzed: cyavate agatī iti evam gatiḥ ca asau na vidyate  agatiḥ gati śabdena samādhiḥ naditaḥ tathā
translated: It is said to be passing away without going, and thus going is not found.🔽Non-going is said to be concentration with the word going.
This is said to be non-concentration, conceptualization.

original: samāhito eṣa dvitīya manyanā /🔽amanyamānā vicaranti bodhaye
analyzed: samāhitaḥ eṣa dvitīya manyanā  a manyamānāḥ vicaranti bodhaye
translated: This is the second concentration, conceptualization.🔽Those who wander without conceptualization for enlightenment
Without conceptualization, touch the supreme enlightenment.
This is the level of peace, equal and unequal,
This is the sign of tranquility and insight.
Having served this peaceful enlightenment of the Buddhas,
He is engaged in the cultivation of concentration here.

analyzed: na ca punar iyam akṣarehi śakyam
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to enter
The course of meaning with these letters.
Having abandoned all sounds and verbal expressions,
He becomes concentrated, but there is no conceit on his part.
And the bodhisattva who is concentrated here
Should remain as instructed, thus engaged.
If there were a conflagration in this realm,

analyzed: giri vara madhya gatam na tam dahegniḥ
translated: The fire would not burn him in the midst of the excellent mountain.
Just as space has never been burned before,

analyzed: su bahu kalpa śate hi dahyamānam
translated: For many hundreds of eons, it is burning.
Knowing the Dharma to be like space,

original: ste na jātu dahyati so'gnimadhye // //🔽saci puna jvalamāna buddhakṣetre🔽praṇidhi karoti samādhiye sthihitvā /
analyzed: ste na jātu dahyati sa ugni madhye  saci puna jvalamāna buddhakṣetre  praṇidhi karoti samādhiye sthihitvā
translated: They are never burned in the midst of fire.🔽If, while dwelling in this samādhi, they make the aspiration
That the burning buddha-field may be completely pacified,

analyzed: pṛthivī vinaśyi na ca asya anyathātvam
translated: The earth will be destroyed, but not otherwise.
They will have infinite power of spiritual abilities

analyzed: khaga pathi gacchati saḥ a sajjamānaḥ
translated: And will travel through the sky without obstruction.
The bodhisattva experiences these qualities
By dwelling in the samādhi as instructed.

original: jāyate cyavate vāpi na ca jāti na cyutiḥ /
analyzed: jāyate cyavate vā api na ca na cyutiḥ
translated: There is neither birth nor death for one

original: yasya vijānanā eṣā samādhyasya na durlabhā // //
analyzed: yasya vijānanā eṣā samādhyasya na durlabhā
translated: Who knows this, and this samādhi is not difficult for them to attain.

original: na cyutirnāpi co jāti lokanāthena deśitā /
analyzed: na cyutiḥ na api lokanāthena deśitā
translated: The Lord of the World has taught neither death nor birth.

analyzed: lokanātham viditvā evam samādhim tena jānatha
translated: Knowing the Lord of the World in this way, understand the samādhi through that.

analyzed: an upaliptā lokena loka dharme na sajjati
translated: Unstained by the world, they are not attached to worldly phenomena.
Unattached in body, they go to the buddha-fields.

analyzed: kṣetreṣu paśyate nityam saṃbuddhān loka nāyakān
translated: In the fields, they always see the fully enlightened ones, the guides of the world.

original: dharmaṃ ca śṛṇute tatra buddhakṣetreṣu bhāṣitam // //
analyzed: dharmam ca śṛṇute tatra buddhakṣetreṣu bhāṣitam
translated: And there he hears the Dharma taught in the buddha-fields.

original: na jātu tasya ajñānaṃ dharmadhātuṃ ca bhāṣate /
analyzed: na jātu tasya ajñānam dharmadhātum ca bhāṣate
translated: He never has ignorance, and he teaches the Dharma-realm.

original: gatijñaḥ satato dharme dharmadhātumayo hi saḥ // //
analyzed: gati jñaḥ satataḥ dharme dharmadhātu mayaḥ hi saḥ
translated: He always knows the Dharma, for he is made of the Dharma-realm.

analyzed: bhāṣataḥ kalpa koṭyā upi pratibhānam na hīyate
translated: Even if he speaks for millions of eons, his eloquence is never exhausted.
The wise one emanates many other bodhisattvas.

analyzed: kṣetra atas kṣetra gacchanti bodhisattvāna nirmitāḥ
translated: The emanated bodhisattvas go from one buddha-field to another,
Seated cross-legged on lotuses with a thousand petals.
They reveal the enlightenment of the buddhas, the beautiful dhāraṇī sūtras,
And other millions of sūtras, meditating on the peaceful samādhi.

analyzed: avivartika pathe sthāpenti bahūn sattvān acintiyān
translated: They establish countless beings on the irreversible path,

original: pratibhānaṃ kṣayaṃ naiti buddhabodhiṃ prakāśiya // //🔽kūṭāgāre hi gacchanti ratanehi vicitrite /🔽okiranti ca puṣpehi gandhavadbhirvināyakam // //
analyzed: pratibhānam kṣayam na eti buddha bodhim  kūṭāgāre hi gacchanti ratanehi vicitrite  okiranti ca puṣpehi gandhavadbhiḥ vināyakam
translated: And their eloquence is never exhausted as they reveal the enlightenment of the buddhas.🔽They go to the kūṭāgāras, which are adorned with jewels,🔽And scatter flowers with fragrance on the leader.
They scatter fragrant powders on the leader,

original: kurvanti vipulāṃ pūjāṃ sarve te bodhikāraṇāt // //
analyzed: kurvanti vipulām pūjām sarve te bodhi kāraṇāt
translated: They all make vast offerings for the sake of enlightenment.
These are the immeasurable qualities of the bodhisattvas, the protectors.

analyzed: atha khalu candraprabhaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ bhagavantam nirgatam viditvā aśītyā prāṇi koṭī śataiḥ sārdham sarvaiḥ deva bhūtaiḥ anya lokadhātu āgataiḥ ca saṃbahulaiḥ bodhisattva mahāsattva niyutaiḥ sārdham puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepanam gṛhītvā tūrya śataiḥ vādyamānaiḥ chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ ati ucchritābhiḥ mahā mālya abhinirhāram ādāya bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe yena gṛdhrakūṭa parvataḥ yena ca bhagavān tena upajagām
translated: Then the youthful Candraprabha, knowing that the Blessed One had departed, together with 84,000 koṭis of beings, all of whom were gods, and with many niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had come from other world systems, holding flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, and unguents, to the sound of hundreds of musical instruments, with parasols, banners, flags, and bells hoisted high, bringing a great collection of garlands, in order to make offerings to the Blessed One, went to Vulture Peak Mountain where the Blessed One was.

original: upetya ca bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanaistūryatālāvacaraiḥ pravādyamānairmahatīṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā ekānte nyaṣīdat sagauravaḥ sapratīśo dharmaparipṛcchāyai //
analyzed: upetya ca bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ tūrya tālāvacaraiḥ pravādyamānaiḥ mahatīm pūjām kṛtvā ekānte nyaṣīdat sa gauravaḥ sa pratīśaḥ dharma paripṛcchāyai
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and made a great offering with those flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, and unguents, to the sound of musical instruments and drums, and sat to one side with respect and reverence, in order to ask about the Dharma.

original: atha khalu candraprabhaḥ kumārabhūto bhagavantametadavocatpṛccheyamahaṃ bhagavantaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ kaṃcideva pradeśaṃ sacenme bhagavānavakāśaṃ kuryāt pṛṣṭapraśnavyākaraṇāya /
analyzed: atha khalu candraprabhaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat pṛccheyam aham bhagavantam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham kaṃcid eva pradeśam saced me bhagavān avakāśam kuryāt pṛṣṭa praśna vyākaraṇāya
translated: Then the youthful moon-like Candraprabha said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I would like to ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, about a certain point, if the Blessed One would grant me the opportunity to put a question and answer it.

original: evamukte bhagavāṃścandraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtametadavocatpṛccha tvaṃ kumāra tathāgatamarhataṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ yad yadevākāṅkṣasi /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān candraprabham kumāra bhūtam etat avocat pṛccha tvam kumāra tathāgatam arhatam samyaksaṃbuddham yat yat eva ākāṅkṣasi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the youthful moon-like Candraprabha: Young man, ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, whatever you wish.

analyzed: nitya kṛtaḥ te kumāra tathāgatena avakāśaḥ
translated: Young man, the Tathāgata has always granted you the opportunity.

original: evamukte candraprabhaḥ kumārabhūto bhagavantametadavocatkatibhirbhagavan dharmaiḥ samanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ imaṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāvipañcitaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: evam ukte candraprabhaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katibhiḥ bhagavan dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ imam sarva dharma svabhāva samatā vipañcitam samādhim pratilabhate
translated: When this was said, the youthful moon-like Candraprabha said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, how many qualities does a bodhisattva possess to attain this samādhi that is explained as the equality of the nature of all phenomena?

original: evamukte bhagavāṃścandraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtametadavocatcaturbhiḥ kumāra dharmaiḥ samanvāgato bodhisattvaḥ imaṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāvipañcitaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān candraprabham kumāra bhūtam etat avocat caturbhiḥ kumāra dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ imam sarva dharma svabhāva samatā vipañcitam samādhim pratilabhate
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the youth Candraprabha, “Young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have four qualities attain this samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena.
What are the four?

original: iha kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sūrato bhavati suvisaṃvāso dānto dāntabhūmimanuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: iha kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sūrataḥ bhavati su visaṃvāsaḥ dāntaḥ dānta bhūmim anuprāptaḥ
translated: “Young man, in this case, bodhisattva mahāsattvas are gentle, easy to associate with, and have a sense of shame. They have attained the level of self-control and are controlled.

original: sa parairākruṣṭo vā paribhāṣito vā duruktānāṃ durbhāṣitānāṃ vacanapathānāṃ kṣamo bhavatyadhivāsanajātīyaḥ karmadarśī nihatamāno dharmakāmaḥ
analyzed: sa paraiḥ ākruṣṭaḥ vā paribhāṣitaḥ vā duruktānām durbhāṣitānām vacana pathānām kṣamaḥ bhavati adhivāsana jātīyaḥ karma darśī nihata mānaḥ dharma kāmaḥ
translated: When others abuse them, revile them, harass them, or speak unpleasantly to them, they are patient and tolerant, and have the nature of being patient and tolerant. They see karma. They have destroyed pride and have a desire for the Dharma.

original: anena kumāra prathamena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ imaḥ samādhiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: anena kumāra prathamena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imaḥ samādhim pratilabhate
translated: “Young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have this first quality attain this samādhi.

original: punaraparaṃ kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śīlavān bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śīlavān bhavati
translated: “Moreover, young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas have correct conduct.

original: pariśuddhaśīlaḥ akhaṇḍaśīlaḥ acchidraśīlaḥ aśabalaśīlaḥ akalmaṣaśīlaḥ acyutaśīlaḥ anāvilaśīlaḥ agarhitaśīlaḥ abhyudgataśīlaḥ aniśritaśīlaḥ aparāmṛṣṭaśīlaḥ anupalambhaśīlaḥ āryapraśastaśīlo vijñapraśastaśīlaḥ /
analyzed: pariśuddha śīlaḥ akhaṇḍa śīlaḥ acchidra śīlaḥ aśabala śīlaḥ akalmaṣa śīlaḥ acyuta śīlaḥ anāvila śīlaḥ agarhita śīlaḥ abhyudgata śīlaḥ aniśrita śīlaḥ aparāmṛṣṭa śīlaḥ anupalambha śīlaḥ ārya praśasta śīlaḥ vijña praśasta śīlaḥ
translated: He has pure conduct, unbroken conduct, flawless conduct, unblemished conduct, unpolluted conduct, unstained conduct, exalted conduct, independent conduct, unattached conduct, non-apprehending conduct, conduct praised by the noble ones, and conduct praised by the wise.

original: anena kumāra dvitīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ ima samādhiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: anena kumāra dvitīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ samādhim pratilabhate
translated: Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have this second quality, they will attain this samādhi.

original: punaraparaṃ kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvastraidhātuke uttrastacitto bhavati saṃtrastacitto nirviṇṇacitto niḥsaraṇacittaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ traidhātuke uttrasta cittaḥ bhavati saṃtrasta cittaḥ nirviṇṇa cittaḥ niḥsaraṇa cittaḥ
translated: “Moreover, young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas are frightened and terrified of the three realms. They are disgusted with the three realms, and have the intention to escape from the three realms.

analyzed: anarthikaḥ an abhirataḥ an adhyavasitaḥ an abhiṣaktaḥ
translated: They are not interested in the three realms, do not delight in the three realms, are not attached to the three realms, and are not infatuated with the three realms.
They are anxious in their minds about the three realms.

analyzed: anyatra traidhātukāt sattvāni mocayiṣyāmi iti vyāya mate
translated: They strive, thinking, ‘I will liberate beings from the three realms, except for the three realms.’
They progress toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: anena kumāra tṛtīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: anena kumāra tṛtīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam samādhim pratilabhate
translated: Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have this third quality, they will attain this samādhi.

original: punaraparaṃ kumāra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śrāddho bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam kumāra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śrāddhaḥ bhavati
translated: “Moreover, young man, bodhisattva mahāsattvas have faith.
They are insatiable in their quest for the Dharma.
They are learned.
They are fearless.
They are devoted to the Dharma and revere the Dharma.

analyzed: na lābha satkāra śloka gurukaḥ na jñāna gurukaḥ
translated: They do not revere gain, honor, and fame, and they do not revere knowledge.

original: yathāśrutāṃśca dharmān yathāparyavāptān parebhyaśca vistareṇa deśayati saṃprakāśayati hitavastupūrvagamena cittena na jñātralābhakāmanayā /
analyzed: yathā śrutān ca dharmān yathā paryavāptān parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa deśayati saṃprakāśayati hita vastu pūrva gamena cittena na jñātra lābha kāmanayā
translated: They teach in detail to others the Dharma that they have heard and mastered, and they illuminate it, with a mind that is dedicated to benefiting others, and not with a desire for fame or gain.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kimitīme sattvā imān dharmān śrutvā avinivartanīyā bhaveyuranuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheriti /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kim iti ime sattvāḥ imān dharmān śrutvā a vinivartanīyāḥ bhaveyuḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti
translated: Moreover, they think, ‘In this way, may these beings, having heard this Dharma, become irreversible from the highest, complete enlightenment.’

original: anena kumāra caturthena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ imaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabhate //
analyzed: anena kumāra caturthena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam samādhim pratilabhate
translated: “Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have this fourth quality, they will attain this samādhi.”

original: ebhiḥ kumāra caturbhirdharmaiḥ samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāvipañcitaṃ samādhiṃ pratilabhate kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhibhabhisaṃbudhyate /🔽tadanenāpi te kumāra paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyaṃ yathāyaṃ samādhirbahubuddhadeśito bahubuddhavarṇito bahubuddhasaṃprakāśito bahubuddhapravicitaḥ
analyzed: ebhiḥ kumāra caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam sarva dharma svabhāva samatā vipañcitam samādhim pratilabhate kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhibhiḥ abhisaṃbudhyate  tat anena api te kumāra paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam yathā ayam samādhiḥ bahu buddha deśitaḥ bahu buddha varṇitaḥ bahu buddha saṃprakāśitaḥ bahu buddha pravicitaḥ
translated: “Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have these four qualities, they will attain this samādhi, this samādhi of the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, and they will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.”🔽“Young man, in that way you should know that this samādhi has been taught by many buddhas, praised by many buddhas, commended by many buddhas, explained by many buddhas, and analyzed by many buddhas.

original: bahūnāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikānmayā pravrajitvā ayaṃ kumāra sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāvipañcitaḥ samādhirvistareṇa śruta udgṛhītaḥ pṛṣṭo dhārito vācitaḥ pravartito'raṇabhāvanayā bhāvito bahulīkṛtaḥ parebhyaśca vistareṇa saṃprakāśitaḥ /
analyzed: bahūnām ca buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt mayā pravrajitvā ayam kumāra sarva dharma svabhāva samatā vipañcitaḥ samādhiḥ vistareṇa śrutaḥ udgṛhītaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ dhāritaḥ vācitaḥ pravartitaḥ ūraṇa bhāvanayā bhāvitaḥ bahulīkṛtaḥ parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśitaḥ
translated: “Young man, I have gone forth from the presence of many hundreds of thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas have applauded me, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas have entered into the final nirvāṇa, and I have heard from many hundreds of thousands of buddhas this samādhi, this revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena. I have learned it, understood it, kept it, read it, understood it, and promulgated it. I have meditated on it with the meditation of nonapprehending, meditated on it with the meditation of nonperception, meditated on it with the meditation of noncontention, meditated on it with the meditation of emptiness, meditated on it with the meditation of signlessness, meditated on it with the meditation of wishlessness, meditated on it with the meditation of nonorigination, meditated on it with the meditation of nonoccurrence, meditated on it with the meditation of nonexistence, meditated on it with the meditation of nonattachment, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of attributes, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of aspiration, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of effort, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of conceptualization, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of mental activity, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of mind, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of desire, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of anger, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of ignorance, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of afflictions, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of grasping, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of grasping at desire, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of grasping at anger, meditated on it with the meditation of the absence of grasping

original: atha khalu bhagavānimameva bahubuddhanirhārasamādhimukhaṃ pūrvayogakathānirdeśaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā tasyāṃ velāyāṃ candraprabhasya kumārabhūtasya vistareṇa gāthābhigītena saṃprakāśayati sma
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān imam eva bahu buddha nirhāra samādhi mukham pūrva yoga kathā nirdeśam bhūyasyā mātrayā tasyām velāyām candraprabhasya kumāra bhūtasya vistareṇa gāthā abhigītena saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, in order to further teach the past lives of the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Candraprabha, extensively explained this very method of the samadhi of accomplishing many Buddhas in verse:
I remember, in an incomparable and immeasurable kalpa,

The lifespan of Jñāneśvara, the supreme human,

was fourteen thousand years.

In this one eon, these two hundred
leaders of the world appeared.

the invincible Tathāgatas.
Anantaghoṣa, Vighuṣṭaghoṣa,
Vighuṣṭatejas, Vighuṣṭaśabda,

translated: Renowned in song, worshipped in song,
Hero of the voice, sound of the voice,

translated: Power of knowledge, one who has attained special knowledge,🔽Subduer through knowledge, risen above knowledge,🔽Blazing with knowledge, risen above knowledge,

Face of Bhishma, and ocean of Bhishma,

The lord of peace, a hero of peace.

Dharmottara, arisen from the nature of phenomena,

One who goes to the next world after death,

analyzed: na u ca karma kṛtu vipraṇaśyate
translated: Yet the karma done is not destroyed,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa śukla phala dā iti tādṛśam

This is the auspicious gateway of reasoning and method,
Subtle, difficult to see, the domain of the victors,
Where the letter and word cannot be found,
The enlightened mind of the Buddha, the Blessed One, knows.
The vast accumulation of knowledge and retention,🔽Comes from millions of sutras and millions of buddhas,
The domain of millions of buddhas,
That samadhi is taught by the Blessed One.
The liberator from the sickness and disease of the sick,
The wealth that the Bodhisattvas have accumulated,
Praised by all the Buddhas,
Honored by many millions of gods.
The admonitions of all foolish people,

Those who have made offerings to millions of Jinas,

translated: Thus ends the twentieth chapter, on the chapter of the banner of Indra's victory, in the sutra of the great noble king of meditations.
The chapter on past connections.
In the past, in this Jambudvipa,
there were two excellent sons of merchants, heedful.
Having gone forth in the teaching of the Sugata,
they became solitary buddhas, dwelling in a forest grove.
Possessing psychic powers, attaining the four meditations,
skilled in poetry and philosophy, well-trained,
knowledgeable in the stages of the sky and the earth,
they roamed unattached through the sky.

analyzed: te ca tatra vana ṣaṇḍi śītale
translated: In that cool forest grove,
filled with various flowers, delightful,
frequented by flocks of various birds and deer,
they engaged in conversation with each other.
Then, O king, while out hunting,
hearing a sound, he approached that forest.
Seeing the two Dharma teachers, O king,
he felt the highest love for them.
Having had a favorable conversation with them,
the king sat down in front of them.
Then the king's army, numbering
sixty quintillion, approached.
Each of them had a Dharma teacher,
who said to the king, Listen, O Kshatriya!
The Buddha's teachings are supreme and very rare;
O king, always be heedful!
Life always passes without pause,
like the swift current of a mountain stream.
You are afflicted by sickness, sorrow, and old age;
there is no refuge except for good karma.
O king, the foremost of men, protect the Dharma!
Guard the teachings of the One with Ten Powers.
In this final age of great terror,
stand firm, O king, on the side of the Dharma!
Thus the wise ones gave him much advice,
to that king.
Together with sixty koṭis of people,
the king then gave rise to the mind set on awakening.

analyzed: śrutvā dharma tada rāja kuñjaraḥ  bhāṣataḥ
translated: Having heard the Dharma from that foremost of kings,🔽who spoke with eloquence and gentleness,
filled with joy, delighted, and uplifted,
he bowed his head to the Buddha's feet and departed.
To that king, many other monks
came to his palace, desiring gain.
But they did not see such conduct in him,

analyzed: teṣu rāja na tathā sa gauravam
translated: And they do not have the same respect for the king.
And that teaching of the past teachers
Is the last one that is now in place.
In Jambudvīpa, with very few vessels,
