translated: Millions understand this, their progress is inconceivable,

original: jñānena te vivardhante sāgaro vā sravantibhiḥ // //
analyzed: jñānena te vivardhante sāgaraḥ vā sravantibhiḥ
translated: They increase through wisdom, like the ocean through rivers.

original: na teṣāṃ labhyate'nto hi pibato vā mahodagheḥ /
analyzed: na teṣām hi pibataḥ vā mahā udagheḥ
translated: The end of them is not attained, like of one drinking from the great ocean.

analyzed: ākhyātaḥ bodhisattvānām nayaḥ hi eṣa acintiyaḥ
translated: This inconceivable method has been taught for the bodhisattvas.

original: iha koṭayāṃ sthitāḥ śūrā bodhisattvā yaśasvinaḥ /
analyzed: iha koṭayām sthitāḥ śūrāḥ bodhisattvāḥ yaśasvinaḥ
translated: Here, the glorious bodhisattvas, the heroes, stand on the koṭi.

analyzed: svara aṅgāni pramuñcanti yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ
translated: They emit the elements of speech, like the sands of the Ganges.

analyzed: tatas cintyaḥ svaraḥ upi evam bodhisattvaḥ na manyate
translated: And from that, the bodhisattva does not think of the voice as real.
When conceit is abandoned, he becomes close to enlightenment.

original: na sa śīlaṃ vilumpeti api jīvitakāraṇāt /
analyzed: na sa śīlam vilumpa iti api jīvita kāraṇāt
translated: He does not break the precepts even for the sake of his life.
That undiminished bodhisattva practices with firm resolve.

analyzed: na asau bhūyas vilupyeta kam a saṃjñāya sarvaśas
translated: He is never again diminished, having completely abandoned the perception of a self.

analyzed: sarva saṃjñā prahīṇaḥ te aprameyāḥ samādhayaḥ
translated: The immeasurable concentrations are for one who has abandoned all perceptions.

original: samāhitaḥ sa carati sajjate na samādhiṣu /
analyzed: samāhitaḥ sa carati sajjate na samādhiṣu
translated: He practices in concentration, but is not attached to the concentrations.

analyzed: asaktaḥ ca apramattaḥ ca na asau lokeṣu sajjate
translated: Unattached and heedful, he is not attached to the worlds.
Transcending the world-realms, he goes to Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: gataḥ ca tatra saṃbuddham amita ābham sa paśyati
translated: And having gone there, he sees the perfect Buddha Amitābha.

analyzed: bodhisattvān ca tān śūrān lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtān
translated: And those heroic bodhisattvas adorned with the major and minor marks,

original: pañcābhijñāpāramiṃ ca prāptā dhāraṇigocarāḥ // //🔽gacchanti kṣetrakoṭīyo buddhānāṃ pādavandakāḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāpāramim ca prāptāḥ dhāraṇi gocarāḥ  gacchanti kṣetra koṭīyaḥ buddhānām pāda vandakāḥ
translated: Who have attained the perfection of the five higher knowledges, the domain of dhāraṇīs,🔽Go to millions of buddha-fields to pay homage at the feet of the buddhas.
They go to inconceivable buddha-fields, teaching as they go.

analyzed: sarva doṣa prahīṇāḥ ca sarva kleśa viśodhitāḥ
translated: Free from all faults, purified of all afflictions,

analyzed: sarva kleśa samucchinnāḥ eka jāti sthitāḥ jināḥ
translated: The victorious ones, who have cut off all afflictions, abide in their last existence.

original: na co apāyān gacchanti tasmāt kṣetrāttu te narāḥ /
analyzed: na ca u apāyān gacchanti tasmāt kṣetrāt tu te narāḥ
translated: Those people do not go to the lower realms from that buddha-field.
All the lower realms are completely eradicated in that buddha-field.

analyzed: bodhitāḥ buddha śreṣṭhena amita ābhena tāyinā
translated: They are awakened by Amitābha, the best of buddhas, the protector.

original: karotha mā tatra kāṅkṣāṃ gamiṣyatha sukhāvatīm // //
analyzed: karotha mā tatra kāṅkṣām gamiṣyatha sukhāvatīm  /
translated: Do not doubt this, you will go to Sukhāvatī.
If a woman hears the praises of that supreme buddha-field
And gains faith in her mind,

analyzed: sa kṣipra bhotī puruṣa varaḥ su vidvān
translated: She will quickly become a wise and excellent man

analyzed: ṛddhyā ca yāti kṣetra sahasra koṭīḥ
translated: And go by miraculous power to millions of buddha-fields.
The immeasurable and manifold offerings,
as many as there are in the trichiliocosm,
if one always makes those offerings to the supreme beings,

analyzed: saṃkhyā kalāpī na bhavati maitra cittaḥ
translated: with a loving mind, it does not equal a fraction of the merit.
Constantly practicing morality and concentration,
the dhyanas, liberations, and likewise the formless attainments,
constantly practicing emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: nacireṇa so hi sugatu bhavati loke // //
translated: he will soon become a Sugata, a Buddha, in the world.

original: eṣā hi pūjā paramā viśiṣṭa mahyaṃ
analyzed: eṣā hi pūjā paramā viśiṣṭa mahyam
translated: This is the supreme and most distinguished offering to me,
if a bodhisattva is established in the aggregate of morality.

analyzed: sada sarva buddhāḥ tena su pūjitāḥ hi
translated: By him all the Buddhas are well worshipped,

analyzed: kṣaya anta kāle yaḥ bodhi citte  su parīnditāḥ te buddha sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: if he abides in the thought of enlightenment at the end of the destruction.

original: ye bodhisattvā imu kṣayi kāli ghore /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who in this terrible age of destruction
protect the Dharma taught by the excellent Sugata,
those who are my sons, the guardians of the Dharma in the end,🔽they have well honored the koṭis of thousands of Buddhas.

analyzed: iti śrī samādhirāje sūtradhāraṇānuśaṃsāparivartaḥ nāma dvātriṃśatitamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the benefits of upholding the sutra, the thirty-second chapter in the sutra of the great Samadhi of the King of Samadhi.
The chapter of Kṣemadatta.

original: atha khalu bhagavān punareva candraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtamāmantrayate smabhūtapūrvaṃ kumāra atīte'dhvanyasaṃkhyeye kalpe asaṃkhyeyatare vipule apramāṇe acintye aparimite yadāsīt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar eva candraprabham kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma bhūta pūrvam kumāra atīta idhvani asaṃkhyeye kalpe asaṃkhyeyatare vipule apramāṇe acintye aparimite yadā āsīt
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the youth Candraprabha, saying: In the past, young man, in a time gone by, innumerable, vast, immeasurable, inconceivable, unfathomable, asaṃkhyeyas of eons ago,

original: tena kālena tena samayena ghoṣadatto nāma tathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: tena kālena tena samayena ghoṣadattaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: at that time, in that time, there appeared in the world the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with perfect knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unexcelled guide of those to be trained, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed Lord, named Ghoṣadatta.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kumāra ghoṣadattastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho aprameyānacintyānaparimāṇānasaṃkhyeyān sattvānāsravakṣayāyārhattve pratiṣṭhāpya parinirvāpya aprameyānasaṃkhyeyāṃśca sattvānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvavinivartanīyatve pratiṣṭhāpya parinirvṛto'bhūt /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kumāra ghoṣadattaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ aprameyān acintyān aparimāṇān asaṃkhyeyān sattvān āsrava kṣayāya arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpya parinirvāpya aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān ca sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīya tve pratiṣṭhāpya parinirvṛtaḥ bhūt
translated: And that Ghoṣadatta, young man, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, having established immeasurable, inconceivable, unfathomable, asaṃkhyeya beings in the state of arhatship for the destruction of defilements, and having caused them to attain final nirvāṇa, and having established immeasurable, asaṃkhyeya beings in irreversibility in the highest perfect enlightenment, passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena rājābhūcchrīghoṣo nāma /🔽sa tasya tathāgatasya pūjārthaṃ tathāgatadhātugarbhāṇi caturaśītistūpakoṭisahasrāṇi kārayāmāsa /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena rājā abhūt śrīghoṣaḥ nāma  sa tasya tathāgatasya pūjā artham tathāgata dhātu garbhāṇi caturaśīti stūpa koṭi sahasrāṇi kārayāmāsa
translated: “Young man, at that time and in those days, there was a king named Śrīghoṣa.🔽In order to make offerings to that Tathāgata, he had eighty-four quintillion stūpas built, each one containing the relics of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: ekaikasmin ca stūpe caturaśīti caturaśīti dīpa ārdhya koṭī niyuta sahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: In each stūpa, he placed eighty-four quintillion lamps.

analyzed: evam vādyānām tūryāṇām puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākānām
translated: In the same way, he placed eighty-four quintillion musical instruments, cymbals, flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

analyzed: ekaikatra ca stūpe caturaśīti caturaśīti koṭi sahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: In each stūpa, he placed eighty-four quintillion of each of these.

original: ihi hi kumāra sa rājā śrīghoṣastathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā caturaśītyā bodhisattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahastrāṇāṃ mahāntaṃ bodhisattvasaṃnipātaṃ kārayitvā teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ sarvasukhopadhānena pūjāyāmudyukto'bhūt /
analyzed: ihi hi kumāra sa rājā śrīghoṣaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām pūjām kṛtvā caturaśītyā bodhisattva koṭī niyuta śata sahastrāṇām mahāntam bodhisattva saṃnipātam kārayitvā teṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām sarva sukha upadhānena pūjāyām udyuktaḥ bhūt
translated: “Young man, after King Śrīghoṣa had made offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata, he assembled eighty-four quintillion bodhisattvas and made vast offerings to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas with all forms of comfort.

original: sarve ca te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā dharmabhāṇakā abhūvan anācchedyapratibhānāḥ samādhipratilabdhāḥ asaṅgadhāraṇīpratilabdhā bhūtaguṇadharmadeśakāḥ pariśuddhadharmadeśakāḥ bodhisattvavaśipāramiprāptāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ dharma bhāṇakāḥ abhūvan an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ samādhi pratilabdhāḥ asaṅga dhāraṇī pratilabdhāḥ bhūta guṇa dharma deśakāḥ pariśuddha dharma deśakāḥ bodhisattva vaśi pārami prāptāḥ
translated: And all those bodhisattva mahāsattvas were Dharma teachers, had uninterrupted eloquence, had attained samādhi, had attained unobstructed retention, taught the Dharma of true qualities, taught the pure Dharma, had attained mastery as bodhisattvas,

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tatraiva parṣadi kṣemadatto nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvo'bhūcchiśurdaharaḥ kṛṣṇakeśaḥ prathamayauvanasamanvāgate bhadrake vayasi vartamānaḥ avikrīḍitāvī kāmeṣu kaumārabrahmacārī ekavarṣa upasaṃpadā /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tatra eva parṣadi kṣemadattaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūt śiśuḥ daharaḥ kṛṣṇa keśaḥ prathama yauvana samanvāgate bhadrake vayasi vartamānaḥ a vikrīḍitāvī kāmeṣu kaumāra brahmacārī eka varṣaḥ upasaṃpadā
translated: and at that time, in that assembly, there was a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Śrīdatta who was a youth, young, with black hair, endowed with the first bloom of youth, in the prime of life, not yet indulging in sexual pleasures, a celibate, one year since full ordination.

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena ca samayena rāja śrīghoṣastaṃ mahāntaṃ bodhisattvamahāsattvagaṇamadhyeṣate sma yaduta ṣaṭpāramitāsaṃgītau /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena ca samayena rāja śrīghoṣaḥ tam mahāntam bodhisattva mahāsattva gaṇam adhyeṣate sma yat uta ṣaṣ pāramitā saṃgītau
translated: And at that time, at that moment, King Śrīghosa requested that great assembly of bodhisattva mahāsattvas to chant the six perfections.

original: bodhisattvapiṭakamahādhāraṇyupāyakauśalyavaśivinayāsaṅgābhinirhārārthaṃ tān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānadhyeṣya rātrau saṃniṣaṇṇāyāṃ tathāgatacaityasya purataḥ tatrānekāni dīpārdhyakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi prajvālitāni /
analyzed: bodhisattva piṭaka mahā dhāraṇī upāya kauśalya vaśi vinaya āsaṅga abhinirhāra artham tān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān adhyeṣya rātrau saṃniṣaṇṇāyām tathāgata caityasya puratas tatra anekāni dīpa ardhya koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi prajvālitāni
translated: In order to accomplish the skill in means of the great dhāraṇīs of the Bodhisattva canon, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, having requested them, while sitting in the night in front of the Tathāgata shrine, there he lit many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of lamps.

analyzed: sikta saṃmṛṣṭa śodhitaḥ ca maṇḍala mātraḥ kṛtaḥ bhūt puṣpa abhikīrṇaḥ nānā vicitra śayana āsana prajñaptaḥ
translated: And the mandala was sprinkled, swept, and cleaned, made into a level surface, strewn with flowers, and various kinds of couches and seats were arranged.

analyzed: rājā api śrīghoṣaḥ sa antaḥpura grāma nagara janapada pāriṣadyaḥ sa pauraḥ niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: King Śrīghoṣa also went out with his harem, the villages, cities, provinces, and retinue, with the townspeople.

analyzed: vādya tūrya tālāvacara puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ parigṛhītābhiḥ tathāgata caityasya pūjām kṛtvā sārdham antaḥpūreṇa prāsāda talam abhirūḍhaḥ ubhut dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Having made offerings to the Tathāgata shrine with musical instruments, drums, songs, flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags that were taken up, he ascended to the top of the palace together with his harem to listen to the Dharma.

original: mahatī ca devamānuṣikā pariṣat saṃnipatitā dharmaśravaṇārthikā /
analyzed: mahatī ca deva mānuṣikā pariṣad saṃnipatitā dharma śravaṇa arthikā
translated: And a great assembly of devas and humans gathered there, desiring to listen to the Dharma.

original: adrākṣīt kṣemadatto bodhisattvo mahāsatvastāni ca mahānti dīpārdhyakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃprajvalitāni /
analyzed: adrākṣīt kṣemadattaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ tāni ca mahānti dīpa ardhya koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃprajvalitāni
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta saw those many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of great lamps burning,
and the whole of Jambudvīpa was illuminated by their light.

original: sadevamānuṣikāṃ ca janatāṃ dharmaśravaṇāya saṃnipatitāṃ viditvā tasyaitadabhūtahamapi mahāyānasaṃprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣikām ca janatām dharma śravaṇāya saṃnipatitām viditvā tasya etat abhūt aham api mahāyāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Knowing that the assembly of gods and humans had gathered to listen to the Dharma, he thought, I too am set out in the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: yat nu aham imam samādhim ākāṅkṣaḥ tathāgata pūjām kuryām
translated: Therefore, desiring this samādhi, I shall make an offering to the Tathāgata.

original: yathārūpayā pūjayā sadevamānuṣāsuralokaścitrīkāraprāpto bhavedāttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhaveddharmālokaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: yathārūpayā pūjayā sa deva mānuṣa asura lokaḥ citrīkāra prāptaḥ bhavet ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhavet dharma āloka prāptaḥ
translated: By what kind of offering will the world with its gods, humans, and asuras attain joy, become uplifted, be delighted, experience joy and happiness, and attain the light of the Dharma?

original: imāṃ ca sarvāṃ tathāgatapūjāmabhibhaveyaṃ yeyaṃ śrīghoṣeṇa rājñā kṛtā /
analyzed: imām ca sarvām tathāgata pūjām abhibhaveyam yā iyam śrīghoṣeṇa rājñā kṛtā
translated: I shall surpass all these offerings made to the Tathāgata by King Śrīghoṣa.

original: rājā ca śrīghoṣaścitrīkāraprāpto bhavedāttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ sāntaḥpuraparivāraḥ //
analyzed: rājā ca śrīghoṣaḥ citrīkāra prāptaḥ bhavet ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ sa antaḥpura parivāraḥ
translated: And King Śrīghoṣa will attain joy, become uplifted, be delighted, experience joy and happiness, together with his harem and retinue.

original: atha khalu kṣemadatto bodhisattva evaṃcittaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastaṃ mahāntaṃ janakāyaṃ saṃnipatitaṃ viditvā dharmaśravaṇikānāṃ rātrau saṃniṣaṇṇāyāṃ tathāgatacaityasya purataḥ sthitvā dakṣiṇaṃ bāhuṃ cīvarapariveṣṭitaṃ kṛtvā tailaplutaṃ kṛtvā dīpayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu kṣemadattaḥ bodhisattvaḥ evaṃcittaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tam mahāntam jana kāyam saṃnipatitam viditvā dharmaśravaṇikānām rātrau saṃniṣaṇṇāyām tathāgata caityasya puratas sthitvā dakṣiṇam bāhum cīvara pariveṣṭitam kṛtvā taila plutam kṛtvā dīpayāmāsa
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kṣemadatta, with such thoughts, joyful and happy, knowing that the great assembly had gathered, when the listeners were seated at night, stood in front of the caitya of the Tathāgata, wrapped his right arm in cloth, soaked it in oil, and lit it as a lamp.

original: atha khalu kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyādhyāśayenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ paryeṣamāṇasya tathā pradīpte dakṣiṇe pāṇau nābhūt cittasya mukhavarṇasya vā anyathātvam /
analyzed: atha khalu kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya adhyāśayena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim paryeṣamāṇasya tathā pradīpte dakṣiṇe pāṇau na abhūt cittasya mukha varṇasya vā anyathātvam
translated: Then, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta, with a superior intention seeking unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, when his right arm was thus ablaze, had no change in his mind or facial expression.

original: atha khalu kumāraḥ samanantarapradīpte kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pāṇau saṃprajvalite saṃjyotībhūte ekajvālāprāpte /
analyzed: atha khalu kumāraḥ samanantara pradīpte kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pāṇau saṃprajvalite saṃjyotībhūte eka jvālā prāpte
translated: Then, young man, immediately after the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta's arm was lit, blazing and radiant, becoming a single flame,

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahāpṛthivīcālaḥ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām mahā pṛthivīcālaḥ prādurabhūt
translated: at that time there appeared a great earthquake.

original: tasya pāṇau dīpyamānasya prabhayā tānyanekāni dīpārdhyakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi dhyāmīkṛtānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tasya pāṇau dīpyamānasya prabhayā tāni anekāni dīpa ardhya koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi dhyāmīkṛtāni abhūvan
translated: The light emanating from his hand outshone the many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of lamps.

analyzed: sarvāsu ca dikṣu mahān avabhāsaḥ bhūt
translated: And there was a great illumination in all directions.

original: yenāvabhāsena sarvā diśo'vabhāsitāḥ samantāt sphuṭā abhūvan /
analyzed: yena avabhāsena sarvāḥ diśaḥ uvabhāsitāḥ samantāt sphuṭāḥ abhūvan
translated: By that light, all directions were illuminated and pervaded.

original: sa prītisaumanasyajāta imaṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāvipañcitaṃ samādhiṃ valgunā manorameṇa svareṇa viśiṣṭayā vācānuprabaddhaiḥ padavyañjanairvistareṇa sarvaparṣadaṃ vijñāpayan saṃprakāśayati sma /
analyzed: sa prīti saumanasya jātaḥ imam sarva dharma svabhāva samatā vipañcitam samādhim valgunā manorameṇa svareṇa viśiṣṭayā vācā anuprabaddhaiḥ pada vyañjanaiḥ vistareṇa sarva parṣadam vijñāpayan saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: Filled with joy and happiness, he explained to the entire assembly in a pleasant and delightful voice, with distinguished speech and connected words and syllables, the samādhi called The Samādhi, the One who Comprehensively Clarifies the Equality of the Nature of All Dharmas.

original: tatra dvādaśa sahasrāṇi trāyatriṃśatkāyikānāṃ devānāṃ saṃnipatitāni dharmaśravaṇāya /🔽te prītisaumanasyajātā vividhāṃ divyāṃ pūjāmakārṣuḥ /
analyzed: tatra dvādaśa sahasrāṇi trāyatriṃśatkāyikānām devānām saṃnipatitāni dharma śravaṇāya  te prīti saumanasya jātāḥ vividhām divyām pūjām akārṣuḥ
translated: There, twelve thousand gods from the Heaven of the Thirty-three had assembled to listen to the Dharma.🔽Filled with joy and happiness, they made various divine offerings.

analyzed: apsaraḥ gaṇāḥ ca divyāḥ saṃgītīḥ prayojayāmāsuḥ
translated: And the celestial maidens performed divine music.

original: adrākṣīdrājā śrīghoṣaḥ upariṣṭāt prāsādatalagataḥ svajanapuraskṛtaḥ antaḥpuramadhyagato'ṣṭāṅgapoṣadhasamādattaḥ kṣemadattaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ bāhunāvabhāsayantaṃ sarvāḥ prabhā abhibhūya divyayā atikrāntamānuṣikayāvabhāsitam /
analyzed: adrākṣīt rājā śrīghoṣaḥ upariṣṭāt prāsāda tala gataḥ sva jana puraskṛtaḥ antaḥpura madhya gata uṣṭāṅga poṣadha samādattaḥ kṣemadattam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam bāhunā avabhāsayantam sarvāḥ prabhāḥ abhibhūya divyayā atikrānta mānuṣikayā avabhāsitam
translated: King Śrīghoṣa, who was on the roof of the palace, surrounded by his relatives, in the midst of his harem, observing the eight-part poṣadha, saw the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta illuminating the sky with his arm, surpassing all lights with his divine, superhuman radiance.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarasyaitadabhūtabhijñāprāpto batāyaṃ kṣemadatto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar asya etat abhūt abhijñā prāptaḥ bata ayam kṣemadattaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And having seen him, he thought, This bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta must have attained the superknowledges.

original: sa tīvraṃ prema ca prasādaṃ ca gauravaṃ ca cipasthāpya saparivāro mahākuśalamūlapuṇyaskandhopastabdhaḥ sārdhamaśītyāntaḥpurikābhistataḥ prāsādatalādātmānamutprākṣipat yadut kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya darśanāya prītisaṃmodanāya /
analyzed: sa tīvram prema ca prasādam ca gauravam ca sa parivāraḥ mahā kuśala mūla puṇya skandha upastabdhaḥ sārdham aśītyā antaḥpurikābhiḥ tatas prāsāda talāt ātmānam utprākṣipat yat ud kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya darśanāya prīti saṃmodanāya
translated: With intense love, faith, and respect, he and his retinue, supported by the great accumulation of merit and roots of goodness, together with eighty women of the harem, threw themselves from the roof of the palace in order to see and delight in the bodhisattva Kṣemadatta.

original: sa gauravanirjātena kuśalamūlena dṛṣṭa eva dharme saparivāro devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaparigrahaṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: sa gaurava nirjātena kuśala mūlena dṛṣṭe eva dharme sa parivāraḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga parigraham pratilabhate
translated: By the roots of goodness born of that respect, he and his retinue, in that very life, obtained the support of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: sa devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaparigṛhītaḥ punareva rājā śrīghoṣaḥ saparivāraḥ paripūrṇāddhastaśatasahasrikāt prāsādāt patitaḥ
analyzed: sa deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga parigṛhītaḥ punar eva rājā śrīghoṣaḥ sa parivāraḥ paripūrṇāt hastaśatasahasrikāt prāsādāt patitaḥ
translated: Surrounded by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, King Śrīghoṣa and his retinue fell from the palace, which was a full hundred thousand leagues high.

original: na cāsya kāyaviheṭhaścittaviheṭho vā avalīnatā vābhūt //
analyzed: na ca asya kāya viheṭhaḥ citta viheṭhaḥ vā avalīna tā vā abhūt
translated: But he did not suffer any harm to his body or mind, nor did he become discouraged.

original: atha khalu rājā śrīghoṣaḥ ubhau bāhū pragṛhya mahatā janakāyena sārdhaṃ mahāntaṃ nirnādanirghoṣamākrandraṃ cākārṣīt yaduta kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bāhuṃ dahyamānaṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃprajvalitam /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā śrīghoṣaḥ ubhau bāhū pragṛhya mahatā jana kāyena sārdham mahāntam nirnāda nirghoṣam ākrandram ca akārṣīt yat uta kṣemadattasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bāhum dahyamānam dṛṣṭvā saṃprajvalitam
translated: Then King Śrīghoṣa, stretching out his arms, together with the great multitude, let out a great cry of lamentation, namely, upon seeing the arm of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta burning and blazing.

original: sa rājā tena mahatā janakāyena sārdhaṃ prārodīdaśrūṇi pravartayamānaḥ //
analyzed: sa rājā tena mahatā jana kāyena sārdham prārodīt aśrūṇi pravartayamānaḥ
translated: And the king, together with the great multitude, wept and shed tears.

original: atha khalu kṣemadatto bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ rājānaṃ śrīghoṣamāmantrayate smakiṃ punasttvaṃ mahārāja anena mahatā janakāyena sārdhaṃ mahāntaṃ nirnādanirghoṣamākrandaṃ kurvan rodiṣi aśrūṇi ca pravartayasi /
analyzed: atha khalu kṣemadattaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rājānam śrīghoṣam āmantrayate sma kim punar ttvam mahā rāja anena mahatā jana kāyena sārdham mahāntam nirnāda nirghoṣam ākrandam kurvan rodiṣi aśrūṇi ca pravartayasi
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kṣemadatta addressed King Śrīghoṣa, saying, Why then, great king, do you weep and shed tears, together with this great multitude, making a great cry of lamentation?

original: atha khalu rājā śrīghoṣaḥ kṣemadattaṃ bodhisattvaṃ gāthābhigītena prābhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu rājā śrīghoṣaḥ kṣemadattam bodhisattvam gāthā abhigītena prābhāṣata
translated: Then King Śrīghoṣa addressed the Bodhisattva Kṣemadatta with a verse:

analyzed: kṣemadattam mahā prājñam paṇḍitam dharma bhāṇakam
translated: Kṣemadatta, of great wisdom, a learned Dharma teacher,

analyzed: aṅga hīnam viditvā enam tena roditi
translated: When the people saw that he was missing a limb, they wept for him.

analyzed: etādṛśam rūpam idam tejaḥ rāśi samudgatam
translated: This form of yours, arisen from a mass of radiance,

analyzed: bāhu hīnam viditvā hi bhūyas aham api duḥkhitaḥ
translated: When they saw that you were missing an arm, I too became sorrowful.

original: yastvayā dīpito bāhuḥ prabhā muktā diśo daśa /
analyzed: yaḥ tvayā dīpitaḥ bāhuḥ prabhāḥ muktāḥ diśaḥ daśa
translated: The arm that you burned off, the light that was released in the ten directions,

original: ime jihmīkṛtā dītā divyayā tvatprabhūtayā // //🔽prakampiteyaṃ pṛthivī cittaṃ te na ca līiyate /
analyzed: ime jihmīkṛtāḥ dītāḥ divyayā tvad prabhūtayā  prakampitā iyam pṛthivī cittam te na ca līiyate
translated: These lights were dimmed by the divine light that arose from you.🔽This earth shook, but your mind did not waver.

analyzed: tatas utpāditam cittam na eṣaḥ avara kovidaḥ
translated: The mind that you have generated, this one is not of little understanding.
I fell from a palace a hundred thousand cubits high,

original: sārdhamantaḥpureṇeha na ca me kāyu hiṃsitaḥ // //
analyzed: sārdham antaḥpureṇa iha na ca me hiṃsitaḥ
translated: Along with my harem, but my body was not harmed.

analyzed: sādhu te jñānam āścaryam sādhu cittam anuttaram
translated: Excellent is your wondrous knowledge, excellent is your unsurpassed mind,

original: sādhu vīryaṃ ca svārabdhaṃ sādhuṃ cādhyāśayo mahān // //
analyzed: sādhu vīryam ca su ārabdham sādhum ca adhyāśayaḥ mahān
translated: Excellent is the vigor you have undertaken, excellent is your great superior intention.

original: yasya hastau vidahyante na jātvastīha iñjanā /
analyzed: yasya hastau vidahyante na jātu asti iha iñjanā
translated: For one whose hands are burned, there is never any doubt,

original: prītiprāmodyajātaśca bhūyo dharmaṃ prabhāṣate // //🔽pūrṇamāsyāṃ yathā candraḥ sūryo vāsau nabhastale /
analyzed: prīti prāmodya jātaḥ ca bhūyas dharmam prabhāṣate  pūrṇamāsyām yathā candraḥ sūryaḥ vā asau nabhastale
translated: And, filled with joy and delight, he teaches the Dharma again.🔽Just as the moon on the full moon night, or the sun in the sky,

analyzed: sumeru giri rājaḥ vā evam śobhasi māriṣa
translated: Or like Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, so you shine, my friend.

original: ahaṃ pi evaṃ praṇidhiṃ paripūreya paṇḍitaḥ /
translated: I too will fulfill this aspiration as a wise one.

original: kāye premaṃ jahitvāhaṃ kuryāmarthaṃ ca prāṇinām // //
analyzed: kāye premam jahitvā aham kuryām artham ca prāṇinām
translated: Having given up attachment to my body, I will work for the benefit of beings.
I rejoice in the love of the Dharma, my joy in this is inconceivable.

original: yat puno aṅgahīno'si tena me duḥkhamuttamam // //
analyzed: yat punar aṅga hīnaḥ asi tena me duḥkham uttamam
translated: But that you are maimed is my supreme sorrow.

analyzed: kṣemadattaḥ hi rājānam deva nāgehi pūjitaḥ
translated: Kṣemadatta, honored by gods and nāgas,
with infinite eloquence, spoke these verses to the king:

analyzed: na evam syāt aṅga hīnaḥ asau yasya bāhuḥ na vidyate
translated: He is not so maimed who lacks an arm,

original: sa tu devāṅgahīnaḥ syāda yasya śīlaṃ na vidyate // //
analyzed: sa tu deva aṅga hīnaḥ syāt yasya śīlam na vidyate  /
translated: but he is truly maimed who lacks morality.

analyzed: anena pūti kāyena pūjitāḥ me tathāgatāḥ
translated: By this foul body I have worshipped the Tathāgatas,
inconceivable, worthy of offerings, monuments to the whole world.
Filled with infinite thousands,

analyzed: pradadyāt loka nāthebhyaḥ buddha jñāna gaveṣakaḥ
translated: one would give to the lords of the world, seeking the knowledge of a Buddha.🔽But the one who, with a mind full of faith,🔽would recite just one verse of this Dharma teaching,

original: astyeṣā laukikī pūjā anyā pūjā acintiyā /
analyzed: asti eṣā laukikī pūjā anyā pūjā acintiyā
translated: There is this worldly worship, but there is another inconceivable worship,

original: ye dharmān śūnyān jānanti tyajante kāyajīvitam // //
analyzed: ye dharmān śūnyān jānanti tyajante kāya jīvitam
translated: Those who know the dharmas to be empty, who abandon body and life,

analyzed: satya vākyam kariṣyāmi mahā rāja śṛṇohi me
translated: I will speak the truth, great king, listen to me.

original: yā ceyaṃ janatā sarvā imāṃ gāthāṃ vijānatha // //
analyzed: yā ca iyam janatā sarvāḥ imām gāthām vijānatha
translated: And all these people, understand this verse:

original: yena satyena buddho'haṃ bheṣye lokasya cetiyaḥ /
analyzed: yena satyena buddhaḥ aham lokasya cetiyaḥ
translated: By the truth that I will become a Buddha, a monument for the world,

analyzed: tena satyena dharaṇī ṣaṣ avikāram prakampatu
translated: By that truth, may the earth quake in six ways.

original: bhāṣitā va iyaṃ vācā dharaṇī ca prakampitā /
analyzed: bhāṣitā vaḥ iyam vācā dharaṇī ca prakampitā
translated: This speech was spoken and the earth quaked,

analyzed: āścarya madbhata prāptāḥ deva koṭyaḥ praharṣitāḥ
translated: Millions of gods, filled with wonder and amazement, were delighted.

analyzed: harṣitāḥ deva manujāḥ bodhi cittam upādayuḥ
translated: Devas and humans, delighted, generated the mind of enlightenment,
Innumerable and inconceivable ones set out in the supreme vehicle.
As many as were benefited by the monk Kṣemadatta,

analyzed: buddhānām vartate jñānam yatra akṣayam acintiyam
translated: The knowledge of the Buddhas abides there, inexhaustible and inconceivable.

original: yena satyena dharmo'sau bāhurnāma na vidyate /
analyzed: yena satyena dharmā usau bāhuḥ nāma na vidyate
translated: By the truth that this dharma named Bāhu does not exist,

original: tena satyena me bāhurbhoti kṣipraṃ yathā purā // //
analyzed: tena satyena me kṣipram yathā purā
translated: By that truth, may my arm quickly become as it was before.

original: yena satyena dharmo'sau kṣemadatto na vidyate /
analyzed: yena satyena dharmā usau kṣemadattaḥ na vidyate
translated: By the truth that this dharma named Kṣemadatta does not exist,

analyzed: diśaḥ daśa gaveṣadbhiḥ śunya tvāt na upalabhyate
translated: Even if you search in the ten directions, you will not find it because of its emptiness.

original: yo'pi niścarate śabdastaṃ pu śūnyaṃ vijānatha /
analyzed: yaḥ api niścarate śabdaḥ tam śūnyam vijānatha
translated: The sound that arises, know that to be empty.

analyzed: pratiśrutkā upamaḥ śabdaḥ dharmān evam vijānatha
translated: Sound is like an echo, know phenomena in this way.
One who is always fearless, who has attained emptiness,

original: tasya satyena vākyena sarvaloko na dahyate // //
analyzed: tasya satyena vākyena sarva lokaḥ na dahyate
translated: By his true words, the entire world is not burned.

original: yāvantastribhave sattvā ye devā ye ca mānuṣāḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ tri bhave sattvāḥ ye devāḥ ye ca mānuṣāḥ
translated: As many beings as there are in the three worlds, whether gods or humans,

analyzed: sarvajña tāyāḥ tejena sarve bhonti samāhitāḥ
translated: By the splendor of omniscience, all of them become concentrated.

original: yāvantyupadravāḥ kecid ye divyā ye ca mānuṣāḥ /
analyzed: yāvanti upadravāḥ kecid ye divyāḥ ye ca mānuṣāḥ
translated: As many calamities as there are, whether divine or human,

analyzed: a vaivartika tejena sarve te bhonti nirvṛtāḥ
translated: By the splendor of irreversibility, all of them are extinguished.

analyzed: bhāṣitāḥ ca imāḥ gāthāḥ bāhuḥ ca punar utthitaḥ
translated: These verses were spoken, and the arm was raised again.
And Kṣemadatta's body was adorned with the marks.

original: devakoṭīsahasrāṇi antarikṣe sthitāni ca /🔽mandārapuṣpaistaṃ bhikṣumokiranti ca tatkṣaṇam // //
analyzed: deva koṭī sahasrāṇi antarikṣe sthitāni ca  mandāra puṣpaiḥ tam ca tad kṣaṇam
translated: Thousands of millions of gods stood in the sky🔽And at that moment scattered coral tree flowers over the bhikṣu.

analyzed: amānuṣyehi puṣpehi jambudvīpaḥ hi ayam sphuṭaḥ
translated: This Jambudvīpa was filled with non-human flowers.
And the music of many quintillions of apsarases was performed.

analyzed: imam nādam nadantasya kṣemadattasya tad kṣaṇam
translated: When Kṣemadatta was making this sound,

analyzed: buddha koṭī sahasrāṇi paśyanti idam vikurvitam
translated: At that moment, thousands of koṭis of buddhas saw this miracle.

analyzed: svaka svakeṣu kṣetreṣu ārocet su mahā yaśāḥ
translated: In their own buddha-fields, the greatly famous ones announced:
To the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās:

analyzed: kṣemadattaḥ hi asau bhikṣuḥ paṇḍitaḥ su mahā balaḥ
translated: This bhikṣu Kṣemadatta is wise and greatly powerful.

analyzed: yena asau dīpitaḥ bāhuḥ buddha jñānasya kāraṇāt
translated: He burned his arm for the sake of buddha-knowledge.

analyzed: tena kṣetra sahasrāṇi yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ
translated: By him, thousands of buddha-fields, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,
Were illuminated by a lamp, as if the end of the kalpa had come.

analyzed: puṣpa candana cūrṇaiḥ ca sarva kṣetrāḥ sphuṭāḥ abhūt
translated: The buddha-fields were filled with flowers, sandalwood powder,

analyzed: yāvat bhūmim upādāya jānu mātram abhūt sphuṭam
translated: Up to the ground, knee-deep, they were filled.

analyzed: sarva ratnaiḥ sarva puṣpaiḥ buddhakṣetram abhūt sphuṭam
translated: The buddha-field was filled with all jewels and all flowers.
For the worship of Kṣemadatta, the nāgas rained down pearls.

analyzed: sarva ratna āmayaiḥ vyūhaiḥ idam kṣetram alaṃkṛtam
translated: This field was adorned with arrays of all jewels.
Covered with jewels and pearls, through the worship of Kṣemadatta.

analyzed: devāḥ nāgāḥ ca yakṣāḥ ca kinnara apsara mahā uragāḥ
translated: Devas, nāgas, and yakṣas, kinnaras, apsarases, and great serpents,
Set out for supreme enlightenment, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.
The fully enlightened Lion of the Śākyas, on the Vulture Peak mountain,

analyzed: puratas bhikṣu saṃdhasya siṃhanādam nadī jinaḥ
translated: In front of the assembly of monks, the Victor roared a lion's roar.

analyzed: kṣemadattaḥ aham abhavam śrīghoṣaḥ upi ajitaḥ bhavat
translated: I was Kṣemadatta, Ajita was Śrīghosa,

analyzed: kalpa koṭī sahasrāṇi caran saṃbodhi cārikām
translated: Practicing for thousands of koṭis of kalpas, the conduct leading to complete enlightenment.

analyzed: saha darśanena bhikṣusya kṣemadattasya tad kṣaṇam
translated: The moment the monk Kṣemadatta saw him,

analyzed: acintyābhiḥ tadā strībhiḥ strī bhāvaḥ vinivartitaḥ
translated: At that very moment, by inconceivable women, the state of being a woman was turned back.

analyzed: vyākṛtāḥ te narendreṇa nā asti teṣām vinivartanā
translated: They were prophesied by the Lord of Men, for them there is no turning back.
They will become self-existing ones, all of them guides of the world.

analyzed: śrutvā sūtram idam vidvān saṃlekha guṇa darśanam
translated: Having heard this sūtra, the wise one, who has seen the qualities of austerity,

original: kāye prema na kurvīta iha dharme suśikṣitaḥ // //
analyzed: kāye prema na kurvīta iha dharme su śikṣitaḥ
translated: Should not have affection for the body, well-trained in this Dharma.

analyzed: iti śrī samādhirāje kṣemadattaparivartaḥ nāma trayastriṃśatitamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on Kṣemadatta, the thirty-third, in the Sūtra of the Great Veṇḍa.
The Chapter on the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: tatra bhagavān punarapi candraprabhaṃ kumārabhūtamāmantrayate smatasmāttarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imaṃ samādhimākāṅkṣatā kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena kuśalamūle pratiṣṭhite dharmadānena vā āmiṣadānena vā yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān punar api candraprabham kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma tasmāt tarhi kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imam samādhim ākāṅkṣatā kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena kuśala mūle pratiṣṭhite dharma dānena vā āmiṣa dānena vā yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: There, the Blessed One again addressed the youth Candraprabha, saying, Therefore, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who aspires to this samādhi, who wishes to quickly attain the highest complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, should practice the gift of the Dharma or the gift of material things, established in wholesome roots.

original: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena taddānaṃ catusṛbhi pariṇāmanābhiḥ pariṇāmayitavyam /
analyzed: tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tat dānam catusṛbhiḥ pariṇāmanābhiḥ pariṇāmayitavyam
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva should dedicate that giving through four dedications.
What are the four?

analyzed: yat uta yaiḥ upāya kauśalyaiḥ taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: Namely, by those skillful means, those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, have fully awakened to the highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: teṣām upāya kauśalyānām pratilambhāya idam dāna kuśala mūlam avaropayāmi
translated: I plant this wholesome root of giving in order to attain those skillful means.
This is the first dedication.

analyzed: yebhyaḥ kalyāṇa mitrebhyaḥ antikāt tāni upāya kauśalyāni śṛṇuyām udgṛhṇīyām paryavāpnuyām dhārayeyam
translated: From those spiritual friends from whom I will hear, receive, master, and retain those skillful means,
Through them, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is fully awakened to.

analyzed: taiḥ yaiḥ kalyāṇa mitraiḥ sārdham samavadhānam bhavet
translated: Through them, wholesome spiritual friends are encountered.

analyzed: evam etat dāna kuśala mūlam avaropayāmi
translated: In this way, I plant these roots of virtue.
This is the second transformation.

original: ye bhogapratilābhāḥ sarvalokopajīvyā bhaveyustairme bhogapratilābhaiḥ samavadhānaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: ye bhoga pratilābhāḥ sarva loka upajīvyāḥ bhaveyuḥ taiḥ me bhoga pratilābhaiḥ samavadhānam bhavet
translated: May I encounter those enjoyments that would be of benefit to all worlds.

analyzed: evam idam kuśala mūla vara upayāmi
translated: In this way, I plant these roots of virtue.
This is the third transformation.

original: ya ātmabhāvapratilābhaḥ dvābhyāmanugrahābhyāṃ sattvānanugṛhṇīyādāmiṣānugraheṇa ca dharmānugraheṇa ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ātma bhāva pratilābhaḥ dvābhyām anugrahābhyām sattvān anugṛhṇīyāt āmiṣa anugraheṇa ca dharma anugraheṇa ca
translated: May I attain a body that would benefit beings through the two kinds of assistance: material assistance and the assistance of the Dharma.

analyzed: tasya me ātma bhāvasya pratilambhaḥ bhavet
translated: May I attain that body.

analyzed: evam idam kuśala mūla vara upayāmi
translated: In this way, I plant these roots of virtue.
This is the fourth transformation.

original: ābhiḥ kumāra catasṛbhiḥ pariṇāmanābhirbodhisattvena mahāsattvena tāni kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni //
analyzed: ābhiḥ kumāra catasṛbhiḥ pariṇāmanābhiḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tāni kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: Young man, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should transform those roots of virtue with these four transformations.🔽(1) Young man, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have the four kinds of correct understanding will attain the samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, and will quickly attain the tolerance of the non-production of phenomena. What are the four? They are the correct understanding of phenomena, the correct understanding of meaning, the correct understanding of language, and the correct understanding of eloquence.🔽Young man, what is the correct understanding of phenomena?

original: punaraparaṃ kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvenemaṃ samādhimākāṅkṣatā gṛhīṇā vā pravrajitena vā kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmena śīlavanto guṇavantaḥ prajñāvanto bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sevitavyā bhajitavyāḥ paryupāsitavyā aśāṭhyena /
analyzed: punar aparam kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imam samādhim ākāṅkṣatā gṛhīṇāḥ vā pravrajitena vā kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena śīlavantaḥ guṇavantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sevitavyāḥ bhajitavyāḥ paryupāsitavyāḥ a śāṭhyena
translated: “Moreover, young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes for this samādhi, who wishes to attain quickly the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, whether a householder or one gone forth, should, without deceit, serve, attend, and honor those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have correct conduct, good qualities, and wisdom.

analyzed: yaḥ asya samādheḥ dhārakaḥ bhikṣuḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhavet
translated: If there is a bhikṣu bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses this samādhi,

analyzed: sa ca syāt ābādhikaḥ bāḍha glānaḥ
translated: and if he should become afflicted with an illness,

analyzed: tena sva māṃsa śoṇi atena api sa bhikṣuḥ tasmāt ābādhāt vyutthāpayitum utsoḍhavyaḥ
translated: with one’s own flesh and blood one should strive to free that bhikṣu from that illness.

original: adhyāśayasaṃpannena kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvenemaṃ samādhimākāṅkṣata kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhukāmenāvikampamānena viśāradena svakaṃ māṃsaśoṇitamapi parityajya dharmabhāṇako bhikṣurābādhād vyutthāpayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: adhyāśaya saṃpannena kumāra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena imam samādhim ākāṅkṣata kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena a vikampamānena viśāradena svakam māṃsa śoṇitam api parityajya dharma bhāṇakaḥ bhikṣuḥ ābādhāt vyutthāpayitavyaḥ
translated: Young man, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses the highest aspiration, who wishes for this samādhi, and who wishes to attain quickly the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, should, without wavering and without fear, even give up one’s own flesh and blood, and free the bhikṣu who teaches the Dharma from his illness.”

analyzed: tat anena api te kumāra paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: By this method also, young man, you should know it in this way.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ kumāra atīte'dhvanyasaṃkhyeye kalpe asaṃkhyeyatare vipule apramāṇe yadāsīt tena kālena tena samayenācintyapraṇidhānaviśeṣasamudgatarājo nāma tathāgato'han samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam kumāra atīta idhvani asaṃkhyeye kalpe asaṃkhyeyatare vipule apramāṇe yadā āsīt tena kālena tena samayena acintyapraṇidhānaviśeṣasamudgatarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ uhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: In the past, young man, in a time gone by, in an incalculably long eon ago, beyond an eon of dissolution, beyond twenty eons of dissolution, at a time when a buddha had arisen in the world named Acintya-pranidhana-visesha-samudgata-raja, a Tathagata, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Bhagavat, at that time and in those days, there was a great city named Acintapunya-sudarshana, the capital of the Jambudvipa continent, which was prosperous, wealthy, peaceful, abundant in food, filled with many people and various living creatures, and which had expanded to its fullest extent.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kumāra acintyapraṇidhānaviśeṣasamudgatarājastathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yasminneva divase'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhastatraiva divase parihate aprameyānasaṃkhyeyān buddhanirmitān nirmāya aparimāṇānāṃ ca sattvānāṃ vinayaṃ kṛtvā āsravakṣayāyārhattve pratiṣṭhāpya aparimāṇāṃśca sattvānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvavinivartanīyatve pratiṣṭhāpya tatraiva divase parinirvṛto'bhūt /
analyzed: sa khalu punar kumāra acintya praṇidhāna viśeṣa samudgata rājaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yasmin eva divasena uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ tatra eva divase parihate aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān buddha nirmitān nirmāya aparimāṇānām ca sattvānām vinayam kṛtvā āsrava kṣayāya arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpya aparimāṇān ca sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau a vinivartanīya tve pratiṣṭhāpya tatra eva divase parinirvṛtaḥ abhūt
translated: “Moreover, young man, on the very day that the Tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Acintya­praṇidhāna­viśeṣa­samudgata­rāja attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, on that very day, after the passing of that day, having emanated countless, innumerable buddha emanations, having guided countless beings and established them in arhatship and in the cessation of defilements, having established countless beings in irreversible progress toward the highest, complete enlightenment, on that very day he passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: tasya khalu punarbhagavataḥ parinirvṛtasya caturaśītiḥ varṣakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi saddharmo'tiṣṭhat /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar bhagavataḥ parinirvṛtasya caturaśītiḥ varṣa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi saddharmaḥ utiṣṭhat
translated: “Moreover, after the passing into parinirvāṇa of that Bhagavān, the Dharma remained for eighty-four quintillion years.

original: tasya ca bhagavato'cintyapraṇidhānaviśeṣasamudgatarājasya tathāgatasya śāsanāntardhānakālasamaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāṃ vartamānāyāṃ bahavo bhikṣavaḥ prādurbhūtā upalambhadṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavatā ucintya praṇidhāna viśeṣa samudgatarājasya tathāgatasya śāsana antardhāna kāla samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām vartamānāyām bahavaḥ bhikṣavaḥ prādurbhūtāḥ upalambha dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: “At the time when the teaching of that Bhagavān Acintya­praṇidhāna­viśeṣa­samudgata­rāja was disappearing, during the last five hundred years of the degenerate time, there were many bhikṣus who appeared with the view of objective reality.

original: teṣāmevaṃrūpāḥ sūtrāntā na rocante na cādhimucyante pratibādhante pratikṣipanti /🔽īdṛśānāṃ ca sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ pīḍāṃ kurvanto yāvajjīvitād vyavaropaṇamakārṣuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām evaṃrūpāḥ sūtrāntāḥ na rocante na ca adhimucyante pratibādhante pratikṣipanti  īdṛśānām ca sūtrānta dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām pīḍām kurvantaḥ yāvat jīvitāt vyavaropaṇam akārṣuḥ
translated: They do not delight in such sūtras, do not have faith in them, oppose them, and reject them.🔽They inflicted harm on the bhikṣus who upheld such sūtras, up to taking their lives.

original: tairabhisatkārādhyavasitairīdṛśasutrāntadhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣuṇāṃ sahasraṃ jīvitād vyavaropitamabhūt /🔽tena ca punaḥ kumāra kālena tena samayena rājābhūd jñānabalo nāma jambudvīpeśvaraḥ saddharmaparigrāhakaḥ pūrvapraṇidhānasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ abhisatkāra adhyavasitaiḥ īdṛśa sutrānta dhārakāṇām bhikṣuṇām sahasram jīvitāt vyavaropitam abhūt  tena ca punar kumāra kālena tena samayena rājā abhūt jñānabalaḥ nāma jambudvīpa īśvaraḥ saddharma parigrāhakaḥ pūrva praṇidhāna saṃpannaḥ
translated: Those who were attached to honor and gain killed a thousand bhikṣus who upheld such sūtras, taking their lives.🔽At that time, young man, there was a king named Jñānabala, a lord of Jambudvīpa who upheld the true Dharma, who had fulfilled his previous aspirations.

original: tena khalu punaḥ kumāra kālena tena samayena iha jambudvīpe eko bhikṣurdharmabhāṇako'bhūt tasya samādherdhārako bhūtamatirnāmnā tasya rājñaḥ kulapraveśakaḥ kalyāṇamitro hitaiṣī anukampakaḥ arthakāmaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar kumāra kālena tena samayena iha jambudvīpe ekaḥ bhikṣuḥ dharma bhāṇakaḥ bhūt tasya samādheḥ dhārakaḥ bhūtamatiḥ nāmnā tasya rājñaḥ kula praveśakaḥ kalyāṇa mitraḥ hita eṣī anukampakaḥ artha kāmaḥ
translated: At that time, young man, in this Jambudvīpa there was a single Dharma teacher bhikṣu named Bhūtamati, who upheld that samādhi, who entered the king's palace, who was a spiritual friend, who wished for his welfare, who had compassion, and who desired his benefit.

original: sa cāsya rājā atṛpto darśanenābhīkṣṇapratikāṅkṣī cābhūddarśanena dharmasaṃkathanopasaṃkramaṇaparyupāsanaparipṛcchāgrahaṇadhāraṇavācanavijñāpanasamarthaḥ
analyzed: sa ca asya rājā atṛptaḥ darśanena abhīkṣṇa pratikāṅkṣī ca abhūt darśanena dharma saṃkathana upasaṃkramaṇa paryupāsana paripṛcchā grahaṇa dhāraṇa vācana vijñāpana samarthaḥ
translated: And that king, insatiable in seeing him, constantly longing to see him, was able to approach, attend upon, ask questions, receive, retain, recite, and understand the Dharma talk.

analyzed: sa khalu punar dharmabhāṇakaḥ bhikṣuḥ sattvānām īryā caryā adhimukti dhātu vāsanā kuśalaḥ bhūt
translated: Moreover, that Dharma-expounding bhikṣu became skilled in the conduct, behavior, inclinations, and dispositions of beings.

original: sattvānāmindriyabalavīryavimātratājñānadhātuvāsanākuśalaḥ satyasaṃdhikuśalaḥ visaṃdhiprativacanakuśalaḥ arthaviniścayakuśalaḥ gambhīrapratibhānaḥ sattvānāṃ vinayavidhijñaḥ pūrvābhilāpī smitamukhaḥ apagatabhrūkuṭimukho mahadgatacittavihārī mahākarūṇābhiyuktaḥ anabhibhūtaḥ sarvaparapravādibhiḥ tena ca kumāra kālena tena ca samayena rājño jñānabalasya duhitā dārikābhūt ṣoḍaśavarṣā jātyā abhirūpā prāsādikā darśanīyā paramayā śubhavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgatā jñānāvatī nāma /
analyzed: sattvānām indriya bala vīrya vimātra tā jñāna dhātu vāsanā kuśalaḥ satya saṃdhi kuśalaḥ visaṃdhi prativacana kuśalaḥ artha viniścaya kuśalaḥ gambhīra pratibhānaḥ sattvānām vinaya vidhi jñaḥ pūrva abhilāpī smita mukhaḥ apagata bhrūkuṭi mukhaḥ mahadgata citta vihārī mahā karūṇā abhiyuktaḥ anabhibhūtaḥ sarva para pravādibhiḥ tena ca kumāra kālena tena ca samayena rājñaḥ jñāna balasya duhitā dārikā abhūt ṣoḍaśa varṣā jātyā abhir
translated: At that time, Prince, King Jñānabala had a daughter named Jñānāvatī who was sixteen years old, beautiful, pleasant, and attractive, endowed with the highest beautiful complexion,

original: tasyāḥ sa bhūtamatirbhikṣurācāryo'bhūt kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu saṃdarśakaḥ samuttejakaḥ saṃpraharṣakaḥ samādāpakaḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ sa bhūtamatiḥ bhikṣuḥ ācāryaḥ bhūt kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu saṃdarśakaḥ samuttejakaḥ saṃpraharṣakaḥ samādāpakaḥ
translated: and that bhikṣu Bhūtamati was her teacher in wholesome dharmas, showing, exhorting, encouraging, and instructing her.

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣormahākṛṣṇavaisarpaḥ ūrau prādurabhūt duścikitsyo durlabhabhaiṣajyaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhikṣoḥ mahā kṛṣṇa vaisarpaḥ ūrau prādurabhūt duścikitsyaḥ durlabha bhaiṣajyaḥ
translated: “Young man, at that time, on that occasion, the bhikṣu dharmabhāṇaka developed a serious illness, a great black tumor that was difficult to cure and difficult to treat.
He was rejected by the physician.

original: atha khalu rājā sāntapuraḥ saputraḥ saduhitṛparivāraḥ taṃ bhikṣuṃ glānaṃ viditvā prārodīdaśrūṇi pravartayati sma sārdhamaśītyā strīsahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ paurairnāgaraiḥ sārdhaṃ rāṣṭreṇa naigamajānapadairgaṇakamahāmātraiḥ sārdhamamātyadauvārikapāriṣadyaiḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā sa antapuraḥ sa putraḥ sa duhitṛ parivāraḥ tam bhikṣum glānam viditvā prārodīt aśrūṇi pravartayati sma sārdham aśītyā strī sahasraiḥ sārdham pauraiḥ nāgaraiḥ sārdham rāṣṭreṇa naigama jānapadaiḥ gaṇaka mahāmātraiḥ sārdham amātya dauvārika pāriṣadyaiḥ
translated: “Then the king, together with his harem, his sons, his daughters, his retinue, and his court, having learned that the bhikṣu was sick, wept and shed tears, together with eighty thousand women, together with the citizens and country people, together with the people of the land, the towns, and the countryside, together with the astrologers, the ministers, the great ministers, the advisers, the doorkeepers, and the attendants.

original: te sarve taṃ bhikṣuṃ glānaṃ viditvā prarodantaḥ aśraṇi pravartayāmāsuḥ mā khalvayaṃ bhikṣuḥ kālaṃ kuryāditi /
analyzed: te sarve tam bhikṣum glānam viditvā prarodantaḥ pravartayāmāsuḥ mā khalu ayam bhikṣuḥ kālam kuryāt iti
translated: All of them, having learned that the bhikṣu was sick, wept and shed tears, thinking, ‘Do not let this bhikṣu die!’

original: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena rājño jñānabalasyānyatarā devatā purāṇasālohitābhūdanubaddhā /
analyzed: tena ca kumāra kālena tena samayena rājñaḥ jñāna balasya anyatarā devatā purāṇa sālohitā abhūt anubaddhā
translated: “Young man, at that time, on that occasion, there was a certain deity who had been a friend of King Jñānabala in the past and who was bound to him.

original: sā tasya rājñaḥ svapnāntargatasyāpadarśayati smasacet mahārāja etasya bhikṣornavakenāsaṃkliṣṭena mānuṣyeṇa rudhireṇaiṣa kṛṣṇavaisarpa ālipyeta /
analyzed: sā tasya rājñaḥ svapna antargatasya apadarśayati sma saced mahā rāja etasya bhikṣoḥ navakena asaṃkliṣṭena mānuṣyeṇa rudhireṇa eṣa kṛṣṇavaisarpaḥ ālipyeta
translated: She appeared in the king's dream and said, 'Your Majesty, if you were to smear this monk with fresh, uncontaminated human blood,

original: navakaṃ cāsaṃkliṣṭaṃ mānuṣaṃ māsaṃ nānārasasaṃprayuktaṃ bhojanaṃ dīyeta /
analyzed: navakam ca asaṃkliṣṭam mānuṣam māsam nānā rasa saṃprayuktam bhojanam dīyeta
translated: and give him fresh, uncontaminated human flesh mixed with various flavors for a month,

analyzed: evam eṣa bhikṣuḥ asmāt ābādhāt vyuttiṣṭheta
translated: then this monk would recover from this illness.'

original: atha khalu rājā jñānabalastasyā rātryā atyayena tataḥ svapnāntarāt prativibuddho'ntaḥpuramadhyagataḥ imāṃ svapnaprakṛtimantaḥpurāyārocayāmāsaevaṃrūpaḥ svapno mayā dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu rājā jñānabalaḥ tasyāḥ rātryāḥ atyayena tatas svapna antarāt prativibuddhaḥ ntaḥpura madhya gataḥ imām svapna prakṛtim antaḥpurāya ārocayāmāsa evaṃrūpaḥ svapnaḥ mayā dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, when the night had passed, King Jñānabala awoke from that dream, went to the inner palace, and told the women about the dream, saying, I had a dream like this.

original: iti hi kumāra tataḥ stryāgārāttataśca rājakulānna kācit śrī utsahate tasya bhikṣostadbhaiṣajyaṃ dātum /
analyzed: iti hi kumāra tatas stryāgārāt tatas ca rājakulāt na kācid śrī utsahate tasya bhikṣoḥ tat bhaiṣajyam dātum
translated: Thus, young man, no one in the women's quarters or the royal palace dared to give the monk that medicine.

analyzed: jñānāvatī api rāja duhitā imam īdṛśam eva svapnam adrākṣīt
translated: The princess Jñānāvatī also had the same kind of dream.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ prativibuddhā antaḥpuramadhye imāmeva svapnaprakṛtiṃ mātṝṇāṃ parivārasya cārocayati sma /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar prativibuddhā antaḥpura madhye imām eva svapna prakṛtim mātṝṇām parivārasya ca ārocayati sma
translated: Having seen it, she awoke and told the same dream to the women of the inner palace and her retinue in the inner palace.

original: na ca kācidutsahate strī tasya bhikṣoretad bhaiṣajyaṃ dātum //
analyzed: na ca kācid utsahate strī tasya bhikṣoḥ etat bhaiṣajyam dātum
translated: And no woman was willing to give the monk that medicine.

original: atha khalu jñānavatī rājaduhitā tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanaskā pramuditā prītisaumanasyajātā evaṃ vyavasāyamakārṣītyannvahametad bhaiṣajyaṃ svakāccharīrād yathopadiṣṭaṃ navaṃ rudhiraṃ navaṃ ca māṃsaṃ dadyām /
analyzed: atha khalu jñānavatī rāja duhitā tuṣṭā udagrā ātta manaskā pramuditā prīti saumanasya jātā evam vyavasāyam akārṣi iti an u aham etat bhaiṣajyam svakāt śarīrāt yathā upadiṣṭam navam rudhiram navam ca māṃsam dadyām
translated: Then the princess Jñānavatī, being pleased, elated, delighted, and joyful, with a happy mind and a sense of joy, made this resolve: “Every day I will give this medicine from my own body, as instructed, fresh blood and fresh flesh.”

original: ahameveha rājakule sarvadaharā ca sarvataruṇī ca asaṃkliṣṭakāyavāṅbhanaskarmā ca /
